She contacted the Fundación Paraguaya advisor about setting up a group and managed to join together 16 women who are now working happily on their second loan cycle.

All of the women take an active part in their weekly meetings and are very grateful to Fundación Parguaya.  One of the members of the group is Maria Luisa who is a young student.  She does computer work from her home.  She has a sign which offers her services and she is constantly receiving orders for practical work from schools, universities, etc.  She comments that her income is quite good and helps her a lot with her expenses.  She is requesting this loan so that she can pay to have her computer serviced since it is her main work tool.

loans.use: To have her computer serviced

loans.name: Nver

texts.en: Nver P. is a farmer. For the family of 6, the main income comes from land cultivating and cattle farming. In the harsh winter conditions and with few resources, it is vital to work hard all through the year to sustain the children and family. Nver has applied for the loan to buy cattle feed for the winter period.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed for the winter period.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Klacouma, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, des ustensiles de cuisine des céréales et des condiments.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. CHITAN D. s’approvisionne en ustensiles de cuisine au marché de Massigui. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Djekafo group are all married women, averaging 48 years of age with four children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Klacouma, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They know each other through family links. They sell clothing, kitchen utensils, cereals, and condiments.

The group members are now on their tenth solidarity loan. Chitan D. buys her stock of kitchen utensils at the Masigui market. She sells out of her home and at the nearby markets, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, which will be used for repaying the loan, covering some expenses related to healthcare, food, school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing kitchen utensils

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal est née en 1979 à Dangbo, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Claude, Chantal est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a environs deux ans que Chantal et sa famille se sont installées à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Chantal n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis trois ans, Chantal mène comme activité la vente de divers (pâtes alimentaires, savons, sardine, conserves, etc.) et également de l’eau glacée de façon ambulante. Chantal achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Chantal avait obtenu auprès de ALIDé quatre crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a amélioré son niveau de vie. Dans le but d’agrandir davantage son activité et de se faire plus de revenu, Chantal sollicite encore une fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Chantal was born in 1979 in Dangbo, in the Ouémé department. Married to Claude, a driver, Chantal is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. About two years ago, Chantal and her family moved to Sèkandji, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. The spouses jointly take care of household expenses. Chantal did not go to school. For three years, Chantal has been selling general merchandise (pasta, soap, sardines, canned food etc) as well as iced water, as a street vendor. Chantal stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. She had four prior loans from ALIDé, all well repaid, which helped her improve her quality of life. In order to continue growing her business and increase her revenues, Chantal is once again seeking financing from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing miscellaneous products (canned food, pasta, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Ruth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ruth del Socorro A. B. es una mujer de 46 años que siempre se ha caracterizado por sus grandes deseos de superación. Después de intentar diferentes actividades que le permitieran obtener el sustento diario, decidió aprovechar un pequeño espacio para montar su propia panadería en la cual ofrece diferentes productos a base de harina y queso.
A pesar de que su negocio carece de las condiciones mínimas para ofrecer el mejor servicio, puesto que está ubicado en un pequeño lugar improvisado y sin las condiciones de sanidad requeridas, Ruth trabaja con esmero alrededor de 15 horas diarias para producir el producto que se ha convertido en la fuente de sustento familiar, toda vez que su esposo es obrero de la construcción que trabaja por contratos y en algunas temporadas del año no recibe ingresos.
El mayor anhelo de Ruth es obtener un crédito para ampliar su local e incrementar la producción, así tendrá mayor capacidad de respuesta para sus clientes y logrará incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ruth del Socorro A. B. is a 46 year old woman who has always been known for her great desire to succeed.  After trying different activities, which allowed her to get her daily bread, she decided to take advantage of a small space in order to establish her own bakery.  She sells different products made from flour and cheese.

Her business lacks the minimum conditions for providing better service, it is located in a small improvised place, and it does not have the requisite sanitary conditions.  In spite of all this, Ruth works hard, about 15 hours a day, in order to produce the product that has become the source of income to support her family.  Her husband is a construction worker, and he works by contracts.  During some parts of the year he does not receive any income.

Ruth’s greatest desire is to get a loan in order to expand her place and increase production.  That way she will have a greater capacity to respond to customer demand, and she will manage to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To get a mixer and improvements

loans.name: Margarita De Jesus

texts.es:
Margarita de 29 años de edad, vive con su mamá y sus hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, residen en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a vender tortillas, ha construido un rancho cerca de su casa para elaborar las tortillas junto a su madre, este negocio es la fuente de ingreso para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
Ella quiere comprar una plancha nueva y para realizar la compra solicita un préstamo ya que no cuenta con ahorros suficientes para alcanzar a adquirir esta plancha. Esto le permitirá hacer más tortillas y continuar trabajando por su hogar.
Su sueño es crecer a sus hijos sanos con lo necesario para que puedan estudiar y prepararse además de crecer en el negocio y contar con más clientela.
texts.en:
Margarita is 29 years old, she lives with her mother and with her children, aged 5 and 3, in the the city and region of San Miguel. She sells tortillas. She has set up a place near their home where she makes tortillas with her mother. 

She wants to purchase a new press and to make the purchase she needs a loan as she doesn't have enough savings to be able to make the purchase. This will help her make more tortillas and to keep working to support the household.

Her dream is to raise healthy kids with everything that they need to go to school. She also dreams of making her business grow and to have a larger client base.

loans.use: To purchase a new tortilla press.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en: Ara P. had been working abroad for several years. After saving some money, he returned to his homeland and invested in a trade business. He proved to be a successful businessman and a very client-oriented entrepreneur. Ara regularly updates his clothing stock, and has applied for this loan for that purpose.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing inventory.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto de 27 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a su esposa, tiene una hija de dos años de edad, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, negocio que surgió por iniciativa propia desde hace 3 años, lleva el ganado a comercializarlo al tiangue todos los martes.
La vivienda de Rigoberto necesita reparaciones y no tiene recursos para hacer la reparación por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como ladrillo, hierro, cemento, para mejorar la vivienda, este préstamo le ayudara a vivir en una casa en mejores condiciones.
El objetivo de él es continuar trabajando en el negocio y seguir generando ingresos para sacar a delante a su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 27 years old and he lives in the city of El Transito in the region of San Miguel. He lives together with his wife and their two-year old daughter. He buys and sells heads of cattle, a business that he started of his own initiative 3 years ago. He takes his livestock to the market to sell on Tuesdays.

Rigoberto's home requires some maintenance and he doesn't have enough resources to carry out the work. He requests a loan to purchase construction materials such as bricks, rebars, and cement to improve their home. This loan will help him live in a house that is in a better state of repair.

His goal is to keep working in his business and to keep generating an income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase bricks, rebar, and cement.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, de 24 años, vive en la casa de sus suegros, al lado de ellos y de su esposa Mireya de 25 años; juntos trabajan para salir adelante y así progresar. Desde hace 6 años este emprendedor joven se dedica a la fabricación de puertas, ventanas armarios, y todo lo que los clientes le pidan en el taller de metales que tiene su suegra en su casa, y en el cual él trabaja. A veces labora  en el mismo taller y otras veces, de acuerdo al pedido, se dirige a las casas o empresas a realizar la labor en metal, y esta muy satisfecho pues las ganancias son considerables, y con el tiempo ha aprendido bastante de su suegro, quien es especialista en el rubro metalúrgico. Como su esposa tiene 6 meses de embarazo, y esta a punto de ser padre, tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar su propio taller de fabricación metalúrgico, pues se quiere independizar de sus suegros. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Wilfredo tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de metal que necesita para terminar con un pedido que tiene pendiente, y espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 24 years old and he lives in the house belonging to his in-laws. He lives together with is wife Mireya, 25, and they work together to make ends meet and to improve their situations. This young entrepreneurial man has, for the past 6 years, made doors and mirrors and whatever his clients request of him in his mother-in-law's blacksmith shop. He caters to private homes and to businesses to do blacksmithing for them, and he is very happy with the business because his earnings are considerable.  With time he has been able to learn a great deal from his father-in-law, an expert blacksmith.  His wife is 6 months pregnant and he is soon to be a new father. He has many plans for the future, including setting up his own blacksmith shop to become independent from his in-laws. This is the third loan he requests a loan from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and his is committed to making his payments on time, especially because he doesn't want to cause any trouble for those individuals who made this loan possible. This will permit him to keep working and progressing in his plans. Wilfredo's plan is to invest the loan in the purchase of metals that he needs to complete a projet that remains incomplete.  He will improve his earnings with this help.

loans.use: To purchase metals.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana Patricia U. S. a sus 34 años es madre de 3 hijos y si algo tiene claro en la vida es que además de ser empresaria para garantizar el sustento de su familia, desea estar muy de cerca de sus hijos a fin de acompañar su proceso de formación.
Para cumplir estos dos propósitos y teniendo en cuenta la experiencia que años atrás adquirió en la actividad avícola, esta emprendedora montó su propio negocio de cría de pollos.  Realizar esta labor le ha traído grandes satisfacciones puesto que además de que le ha permitido sacar a su familia adelante, como el negocio lo tiene en su propia casa ha podido estar muy cerca de sus hijos para ser testigo de su crecimiento y, con su experiencia, ir inculcándoles desde ya la importancia de tener un negocio propio.
Para seguir desempeñando su actividad, Diana tiene la necesidad de acondicionar mejor su galpón y comprar más aves, por ello requiere un crédito, que de obtenerlo está segura incidirá positivamente en su desarrollo como empresaria y, por supuesto, en un mejor futuro para sí misma y su familia.
texts.en:
Diana Patricia U. S., age 34, has three children.  If there is one thing clear in life, it is that in addition to being a businesswoman in order to guarantee the support of her family, she wishes to be close to her children during their formative years.

In order to achieve both objectives, and keeping in mind the experience she gained in the past in the poultry business, this entrepreneur started her own business raising chickens.  Doing this work has given her great satisfaction.  In addition to allowing her to get her family ahead, the business is at her own house.  She has been able to be with her two children as they grow up.  With her experience she is now instilling them with the importance of having your own business.

In order to continue working with her business activity, Diana needs to fix up her chicken coop and buy more birds.  That is why she needs a loan.  Upon obtaining a loan, she is sure that it will positively affect her development as a businesswoman.  Of course, it will also make for a better future for herself and her family.

loans.use: To fix up the chicken coop and buy more birds

loans.name: Nissondia Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Nissondia, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Klacouma, préfecture de Dioïla; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font la fabrication et vente de vans.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Nissondia sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter uniquement de la matière première  pour la fabrication de vans(grand panier plat en feuille de rônier ).                                                                
KOROTIMI S. s’approvisionne en matière première avec les cueilleurs de feuilles du rônier au marché de Massigui. Elle effectue sa vente sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle exclusivement féminine.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Nissondia group, all married,  are on the average 39 years old with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Klacouma, Diola Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They know each other through family ties. They manufacture and sell “vans” (big flat baskets made of fan palm leaves).
Korotimi S. buys her materials at the Massigui from sellers who pick fan palm leaves. She sells out of her home, at the nearby market, in cash and on credit, to an exclusively female customer base. She plans to achieve an average monthly income  of 20,000 West African Franks, which will be used to repay the loan, cover expenses related to healthcare, food, and school fees, with the rest reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing materials for making "vans" baskets

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 28 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con sus padres y hermanas, Guadalupe tiene una hija de 5 años de edad, el negocio posee el negocio de ropa y vende en el centro de Corinto los días de comercio miércoles y domingo,  desde muy tempano debe prepararse para salir a colocarse en su puesto de venta.
Ella quiere surtir el negocio comprando mercadería y solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión en prendas de vestir que estén de moda. Con el apoyo de este préstamo diversificara la mercadería para los clientes que siempre demandan nuevos estilos y colores.
Sus sueños son grandes surtir el negocio, aumentar el número de clientes, vender más y de esta manera ayudar mejor a su familia y a su hija sacarla a delante con la educación.
texts.en:
Guadalupe sells clothes.  She is 28 years old and lives in Corinto, in Morazán department, with her parents and sisters.  Guadalupe has a 5 year-old daughter.  She owns her own clothes business and makes her sales in the center of Corinto on Wednesdays and Sundays.  She has to get ready very early in the morning so that she can go out and position herself on her sales stall.

Guadalupe would like to stock her business, buying merchandise, and she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in clothes that are currently in fashion.  With the support of this loan, she will diversify her merchandise for her customers who are always asking for new styles and colors.

Guadalupe's dreams are to stock her business, to increase her number of customers, to sell more and, consequently, to be able to better help her family and get her daughter ahead in her education.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Yorleny Andrea

texts.es:
A sus 26 años de edad, Yorleny Andrea P. R. ya ha trabajado en algunas cafeterías y ha tenido hasta su propio negocio de ropa, el cual abandonó hace 6 meses para volcarse a la aventura de tener su propia microempresa: “El Ranchenato”, un lugar para el esparcimiento ubicado en el Parque Principal del municipio de Yarumal-Antioquia. 

Yorleny, invirtió sus pocos ahorros y los de su esposo para adquirir este local, el cual aún necesita más surtido para solventar las necesidades de sus clientes. 

Posicionar el negocio en el sector, generar empleo y mejorar su calidad de vida son los propósitos de esta joven empresaria, quien ve en su negocio la oportunidad para salir adelante.
texts.en:
At her 26 years of age, Yorleny Andrea P. R. has already worked in some cafés, and she has had her own clothing business.  Six months ago she left her clothing business to immerse herself in the adventure of having her own small business, El Ranchenato.  It is a place for relaxation located in the main park in the Yarumal-Antioquia municipality.

Yorleny invested her small savings and those of her husband to get this place.  It still needs to be better stocked to meet the needs of her customers.

Establishing her business in the area, generating work, and improving her quality of life are the objectives of this young businesswoman. In her business she sees the opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and snacks to stock her business with more products

loans.name: Fatima Mercedes

texts.es:
Fátima es una pequeña comerciante que ha crecido gracias a su tenacidad y apoyo de la institución, tiene 5 años de haber establecido su negocio, iniciando con pequeñas compras de mercadería, hoy en día con  Afodenic sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías, En donde ha comprado vitrinas para exhibir más sus productos.
Teniendo el apoyo de sus padres que hicieron posible este inicio, con ayuda económicas.  
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: pantalones para dama, caballeros, camisas, camisetas, ropa interior, sandalias para niñas, cosméticos, perfume. Logrando vender más.
texts.en:
Fátima is a small businesswoman who has grown in her business thanks to her tenacity and the support of our institution.  She has been in her business for 5 years and began by making small purchases of merchandise.  Today, with the help of Afodenic, her sales levels have risen and she is offering a greater variety of merchandise.  She has also bought display cases to better display her products.

Fátima has the support of her parents who made it possible for her to start her business by providing her with financial help.

Fátima will use this new loan to buy: women's and men's pants, shirts, t-shirts, underwear, children's sandals, cosmetics and perfume.  This will help her to sell more.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's pants, underwear and cosmetics which will improve her sales

loans.name: Milton Gregorio

texts.es:
Milton de 61 años, aprendió desde pequeño hacer ladrillos ya que el negocio lo comenzaron sus abuelos y continúo con sus padres.  Poco a poco fue aprendiendo esta actividad hasta que la convirtió en su principal actividad económica. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ha trabajado desde las 05h30am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días. Trabaja solo utilizando un panelon, jaloncillo para su elaboración (El ladrillo es un componente cerámico artificial de construcción, compuesto básicamente por arcilla cocida). 

La continuidad para su negocio es uno de sus grandes deseos porque desde sus abuelos hasta sus padres lo vinieron haciendo por eso quiere continuar con este actividad comprando con el préstamo herramientas para la elaboración de los ladrillos como (jaloncillo, panelos). Quiere en el futuro expandir su negocio y que sus dos hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Milton is 61 years old.  He learned how to make bricks when he was a young boy because this business was started by his grandparents and then continued by his parents.  He learned the trade and it eventually became his main business activity. 

Milton lives in an urban area called 'Orquídeas' (Orchids).  He works from 5.30am to 5.00pm every day.  He works alone, using specialized tools ('panelon' and 'jaloncillo') to make his bricks (a brick is a artificial ceramic building component which is basically made from baked clay).

One of Milton's biggest wishes is to continue in his business because it is what his grandparents and his parents did.  He would like to continue with this business, using his loan to buy tools to make his bricks ('jaloncillos' and 'panelons').  In the future, he would like to expand his business and he would like his two children to successfully finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy jaloncillo and panelon (tools for making bricks)

loans.name: Emprendiendo Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
El grupo “EMPRENDIENDO SIN FRONTERAS”, esta integrado por siete participantes, quienes se caracterizan por el deseo D. progresar a base D. mucho esfuerzo. 
La señora Elizabeth participante activa D. este grupo desD. hace 8 meses, actualmente ocupa el cargo D. tesorera recientemente elegida por el grupo. Ella tiene 28 años D. edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos, uno D. tres años y otro recién nacido que son su motor y motivo para salir adelante, actualmente se dedica al negocio del ensamblaje y la venta D. bisutería quien lo inicia por intermedio D. una amiga, quien le recomendó iniciarlo. El gran sueño D. Elizabeth es formar su tienda D. bisutería (oro, plata) y exportar para así generar un mayor ingreso para su familia y mejorar su calidad D. vida, el préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en su negocio comprando mercadería. Todos nuestro socios se sienten muy agradecidos por todo el apoyo a la microempresa.
texts.en:
The “EMPRENDIENDO SIN FRONTERAS” group has seven members who are all keen to make progress through hard work.

Elizabeth has been an active member of this group for 8 months.  She is currently the group's treasurer and was recently chosen for this position by the other members of her group.  She is 28 years old and lives with her partner.  She has two children: a three year old and a newborn who are her drive and motivation to get ahead.  She currently works making and selling jewelry.  She started her business thanks to a friend who recommended it to her.  Elizabeth's biggest dream is to set up a (gold and silver) jewelry store and export her jewelry so that she can make more income for her family and improve her quality of life.  She will invest her loan in buying merchandise for her business.  All the members of the group are very grateful for all the support their small businesses are being given.

loans.use: To invest in buying merchandise for her business

loans.name: Yeremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yeremakono, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Klacouma, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et de vans.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Yeremakono sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire  et SATOU K., un membre du groupe, compte utiliser le sien pour acheter, des condiments alimentaires.                                                                          
SATOU K. s’approvisionne dans différents marchés, par exemple Massigui pour les condiments frais. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, les dépenses de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Yeremakono group are all married, are on average 47 years old with 4 children, and all live in traditional, extended families in the village of Klacouma, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They met each other through family connections and sell condiments and baskets. The women are on their second group loan and Satou K., one member of the group, plans to use her loan to buy condiments. Satou gets her supplies from various markets, for example, Massigui for fresh condiments. She sells her products locally in the village, for cash and on credit, to customers who are mostly women. Satou expects to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs which she will use to pay the loan installments and for her family's expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marcos es un joven de 20 años de edad, está soltero, vive con su madre y tres hermanos, residen en Corinto departamento de Morazán, él se dedica al ganado y crianza de cerdos, desde temprano su oficio es ordeñar y darle comida a los cerdos, este oficio lo aprendió principalmente de su madre.
Él quiere adquirir un préstamo para comprar una vaquilla y para recolección de cosecha de granos básicos, con la compra de esta vaquilla estará aumentando el número de reces y con la recolección de granos básicos ayudara al grupo familiar.
Su aspiración es continuar mejorando su trabajo para poder estabilizar los ingresos económicos a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos is a young man of 20.  He is single and lives with his mother and three siblings in Corinto, in Morazán department.  He raises cattle and pigs.  Early every morning he milks his cows and feeds his pigs.  He learned this trade mainly from his mother.

Marcos would like a loan to buy a heifer and to harvest his basic grains.  With the purchase of this heifer, he will be increasing his number of cattle and, with the harvesting of the basic grains, he will help his family group.

Marcos' aspiration is to continue improving his work so that he can stabilize his family's financial income.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Samuel Ovidio

texts.es:
Trabajar en la calle es un oficio que Samuel Ovidio O. conoce desde hace 19 años, puesto que su limitada educación formal y  la falta de oportunidades laborales, sumadas a la llegada de su primer hijo, lo obligaron a buscar opciones para el sustento de su familia. 

Fue entonces cuando Samuel empezó a vender periódicos en un conocido barrio de Medellín llamado Laureles, lugar donde actualmente continúa con su oficio inicial, al cual le sumó la venta de dulces, cigarrillos y llamadas a celular. 

Para Samuel tanto el sol como la lluvia son limitantes pues la calle es su sitio de trabajo, para ello espera obtener recursos con el fin de adquirir además de cigarrillos y confitería, espera comprar un parasol que le permita cubrirse de la lluvia y cubrir su mercancía, también desea adquirir un cajón en madera para ubicar mejor sus productos. 

Aunque Samuel ya es reconocido en el sector, su meta es crecer en variedad de productos para obtener mayores ingresos, pues espera poder cubrir la educación superior de sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Working on the street is a trade that Samuel Ovidio O. has known for 19 years.  Given his limited formal education, the lack of work opportunities, and the arrival of his first child; he was obligated to look for options to support his family.

That is when Samuel started to sell newspapers in a well-known neighborhood of Medellín called Laureles.  That is where he currently continues his initial trade.  He has added the sale of sweets, cigarettes, and cell phone calls.

The sun and the rain are limitations for Samuel.  The street is his work site.  That is why he hopes to get resources to get not just cigarettes and sweets.  He also hopes to buy an umbrella that will allow him and his merchandise to be covered from the rain.  He also wants to get a wooden box to better cover his products.

Even though Samuel is well-known in the area, his goal is to grow with a variety of products in order to get more income.  He hopes to be able to cover the cost of higher education for his three children.

loans.use: Umbrella, products, and a wooden box

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 40 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Carlos (41) y sus 2 menores hijos; cada día  juntos se esfuerzan para progresar. Esta trabajadora dama se dedica, desde hace 15 años, a la fabricación de zapatillas y zapatos en el taller que instaló en su vivienda. Le gusta mucho su labor pues la desempeña en compañía de su esposo, durante todo el día de lunes a sábado, dice que aprendió desde muy joven pues veía como algunos familiares fabricaban todo tipo de calzados. Manifiesta que es una labor bastante rentable, porque en su taller trabajan en base a pedidos que les realizan grandes comerciantes de zapatos de los principales emporios comerciales de la ciudad. Como es muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado continuar dedicándose al mismo rubro de fabricación de calzado, pero tiene el anhelo de ampliar el negocio, de esta manera espera seguir progresando. Es el 20 avo crédito que tiene con MFP y como es una cliente antigua promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues esta muy agradecida con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Jessica tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de material que necesita para continuar elaborando las zapatillas y calzado pues tiene un pedido grande que espera cumplir para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Jessica, 40 years old, lives in her own home together with her husband Carlos, 41, and their 2 young children. They work every day to improve their lives. This hardworking woman has been a cobbler for the past 15 years, making casual and dress shoes in a shop installed in her home. She greatly enjoys working in the company of her husband, every day from Monday to Saturday.  She learned the trade since she was very young while watching family members making all kinds of shoes. This is a very profitable business because in they start projects after receiving orders from large shoe distributors, the largest retailers in the city. She is very enterprising so in the future she plans on keeping up with her cobbler business. This is her 20th loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and as she is a very experienced member, she knows that she must repay the loan on time. She is very grateful to all of those individuals who made this possible. She will be able to continue to her work and to improve her business. Jessica's plan is to invest the loan she has requested in the purchase of materials that she needs to make casual and dress shoes. She has a large order that has been placed and she wants to fill it and improve her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase materials for shoe-making

loans.name: Djekabara Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekabara, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Sidibela, préfecture de Dioïla; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de céréales et des condiments.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Djekabara sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments.                                                                          MAMOU D. s’approvisionne en condiments au marché de Massigui. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 24 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekabara group are all married 42 year-olds with three children on average; they all live in large extended families in the Fala Sidibela village, Dioïla province in the Koulikoro region (the second largest region in the Republic of Mali). They met through family links and sell cereals and condiments for a living.  They are on their second loan which will be used to purchase condiments. 
Mamou D. sources her condiments from the Massigui market. She sells her wares in the village for cash or credit sales to a customer base primarily made up of women. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 24,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, pay for healthcare, food and school fees, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing condiments

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile est née en 1958 à Missérété dans le département de l'Ouémé. Cécile est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Justin, et a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Depuis une trentaine d'année, Cécile vit avec sa famille à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Cécile n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Cécile prépare de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Cécile se ravitaille en maïs à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cécile a bien remboursé le crédit précédent obtenu auprès de ALIDé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter sa clientèle et son chiffre d'affaire, Cécile demande une fois encore l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Cécile was born in 1958 in Missérété in the Ouémé district. She is married to a driver called Justin with whom she has six children who all attend school; three of the children are in her care.  She has lived with her family in Ekpè, the Sèmè-Podji region, and the couple see to the family's needs together.  Cécile did not attend school. 
She makes 'akassa' (a local drink based on corn starch) which she sells from her home.  Cécile sources her corn from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  Cécile successfully repaid a previous loan received from ALIDé. She is seeking another loan from them in order to boost her business and grow her customer base and revenue.

loans.use: Purchasing bags of corn

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Doña María D. 49 años D. edad, resiD. en Corinto, departamento D. Morazán, vive con su esposo don José Martin y dos hijos Juan Carlos D. 14 años y Xiomara Yamileth D. 17 años D. edad, doña María administra una tienda desD. hace tres años donD. ofrece a sus vecinos artículos D. primera necesidad para el hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para compra mercadería para la tienda, con esta inversión ella pretenD. ofrecer a los clientes variedad D. productos para cocinar y para las prioridades del hogar como pastas, pollo, condimentos, arroz y frijol.
Sueña con un negocio estable con mucha clientela y generar los ingresos para dar la educación y salud a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and she lives in Corinto, in the region of Morazan. She lives with her husband Jose Martin, and their two children: Juan Carlos, 14, and Xiomara Yamileth, 17. Maria has had a general store for the past 3 years, selling to basic household needs items to her neighbors.

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for the store. With this investment she will be able to offer her clients a variety of products for the kitchen, such as pastas, chicken, condiments, rice, and beans. 

She dreams of having a stable business with a large clientele to generate enough income for the education and welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase pasta, chicken, condiments, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Korotemogossigui Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Korotemogossigui, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Sidibela, préfecture de Dioïla; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de céréales et des condiments.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Korotemogossigui sont à leur quatorzième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments.                                                                          
MADOUSSOU S. s’approvisionne en condiments au marché de Massigui. Elle effectue sa vente sur place dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Korotemogossigui group are all married, 44 years old with an average of 3 children, and live in large extended families in the Fala Sidibela village, the Dioïla district, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  
They met through family connections and sell cereals and condiments for a living. The women of the Korotemogossigui group are on their fourteenth solidarity loan which will be used to purchase condiments. 
Madoussou S. sources her condiments from the Massigui market. She sells her wares in the village for cash or credit sales to a customer base made up primarily of women. 
She aims to generate an average monthly benefit of 20,000 FCFA which will be used in order to repay the loan, and pay for healthcare, food and school expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing condiments

loans.name: Norma Aracely

texts.es: La Sra. Norma Aracely, es una persona que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, y este ya es su tercer renovación y con estos créditos ella se ha estado ayudando y apoyando a su familia económicamente, esta es una manera de ayudar al sosten de su familia, ya que su esposo en la fabrica donde trabaja gana poco y su papa es pensionado, por lo que ella necesita el dinero para comprar ropa usada y revender, a ella le gusta este negocio porque ya ha hecho muchos clientes que la buscan y le piden ropa sobre todo para los niños que son los que utilizan mas, la Sra. Norma piensa que si sigue así el negocio pronto se vera remunerada y podrá ganar mas para invertir mas y estar un poco mas desahogada con los gastos.
texts.en: Norma Aracely sells used clothing and this is her third loan cycle. These loans have helped her to financially support her family. She is able to provide for her family, especially important because her husband's wages at the factory are humble and her father is retired. She requires the funds to purchase used clothing for resale. She enjoys the business because she has a large client base that looks to her and place orders for clothing, especially children's clothing which is in highest demand. Norma believes that if her business continues at the same pace she will be able to see greater profits which she will invest in the back into the business and to be less taxed with her expenses.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 24 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements et la restauration.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des habillements et des ingrédients pour la restauration.                                                                          
SITAN H. s’approvisionne en habits au marché de Konobougou. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement en ambulante entre les quartiers de la ville de Konobougou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married women of around 24 years old; they have three children and live in large extended families in Konobougou, the Barouéli district, in the Ségou region (the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family links and sell clothes and food for a living. The women are on their sixth loan which will be used to purchase clothes and food ingredients. 
Sitan Haidara purchases clothes from the Konobougou market. She sells her wares every day through home sales in the different districts of Konobougou town for cash or credit; her customer base is made up of men and women.  
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which will be used to pay back the loan, social ceremony costs, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos, es empleado, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus padres y hermanos, está soltero, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, él trabaja en MOTO STORE desde hace cinco años, donde se encargan de todo lo relacionado a motocicletas.
El además tiene un pequeño taller es propio y quiere adquirir un compresor por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar este compresor que le será de mucha ayuda en el taller, esta inversión le servirá para impulsarse y mejorar el servicio a los clientes.
Su aspiración es lograr un taller amplio para dedicarse solo a él, sin tener que trabajar para otro taller y ayudar a sus padres y hermanos.
texts.en:
Carlos is employed, he is 22 years old, and he lives with his parents and siblings. He is single and he lives in Jiquilisco in the region of Usulutan. He has been employed with Moto Store for the past five years, where he is in charge of anything related to motorcycles.

In addition, he also has his own shop and he wants to purchase a compressor. He requests a loan in order to purchase a compressor which will be of great help in his shop. This investment will motivate him and it will improve the service he provides to his clients.

His goal is to have a large shop and to work there full time, without having to work elsewhere. He wants to support his parents and his siblings.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Mas Que Vencedores Group

texts.es:
CARMELA; de 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, menores de edad uno y mayores de edad cuatro. Ella integra del grupo “MAS QUE VENCEDORES” junto con 6 integrantes mas, quienes son muy entusiastas y emprendedoras.
Desde hace diez años, la Sra. Carmela se dedica a la venta de menús y buffet. Se inicia en este negocio, porque desde los 15 años ella cocina, ya que su padre era cocinero y con el aprendió, ahora junto con su hija que estudia gastronomía desea tener una sucursal de ventas, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo siempre ha ayudado en la educación de sus hijas y la ampliación de su hogar.
La gran meta de Carmela es tener un restaurante campestre, el reciente préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercadería para bufet, ella esta muy agradecida con los inversionistas y con la institución por todo el apoyo que ha recibido y promete cumplir con la puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Carmela is 50 years old, she is married and she has 5 children. One is still a minor and the others are adults. She is a member of the group named "Mas que Vencedores". There are 6 other members in the group and they are all enthusiastic, enterprising individuals.

For more than ten years Carmela has been selling foods, either buffet or a la carte. She started out this business because for the previous 15 years she was a cook. Her father was also a cook and she learned from him. She wants to have restaurant together with her daughter that is studying to be a cook. With time and effort she has put her daughters through school and she has made additions to the house.

Carmela's greatest goal is to have a country restaurant. The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for the buffet. She is very grateful to all to individuals who contributed to the loan, and with the organization for the support they have given her. She is committed to making payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase items for the buffet.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
Luis reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su madre y esposa, es empleado de una empresa financiera desde hace 1 año. Por su trabajo el sale a las afueras y se le hace difícil por la falta de transporte, situación que le lleva a solicitar un préstamo para comprar una motocicleta, este préstamo le ayudara a adquirir este medio de transporte que el tanto necesita para desarrollar las actividades que su trabajo le demanda.
Luis desea desempeñar un buen trabajo para estabilizar la situación económica en su hogar, al igual que cancelar puntualmente este préstamo.
texts.en:
Luis lives in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. He is 29 years old and lives with his mother and his wife. He has been employed by a financial business for one year.

For his work, Luis must travel to the outskirts of the city, which he finds difficult because he has no means of transportation. This situation has prompted him to apply for a loan to buy a motorcycle. The loan will help him acquire the means of transport that he needs to carry out the activities demanded by his job.

Luis wants to do a good job, to stabilize the economic situation in his household and to promptly pay off this loan.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
El señor Fermín es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres, en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente trabaja como chofer del sindicato Simón Bolivar trufi 5, realizando rutas en la ciudad de La Paz. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para el arreglo de su movilidad comprando una nueva caja de cambios y así poder seguir trabajando y tratar de incrementar sus ingresos.
Es su tercer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Fermín is single and has no children. He lives in his parents’ house in the Achachicala zone of La Paz. He works as a fixed-route taxi driver for the Simón Bolivar trufi 5 union. He drives routes in the city of La Paz. This is how he obtains income for his household.

Fermín is seeking a loan to buy a new transmission for his vehicle. This will enable him to continue working and trying to increase his income. This is his third loan, and he has been favorably qualified by the socioeconomic analysis.

loans.use: Buy a new transmission for taxi.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 21 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Yamadibougou, sous-préfecture de Konobougou ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce du savon et de l’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire et                                                                        BAKO COULIBALY compte s’approvisionner en arachide hebdomadairement au marché de Konobougou auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place dans le village et au marché de Konobougou après transformation en pâte d’arachide, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes surtout.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are all married 21 year olds with three children each; they all live in traditional extended families in the Yamadibougou village, in the Konobougou district of the Ségou region (the fourth largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family links and sell soap and peanuts for a living. The women of the Danaya group are on their fourth loan and Bako Coulibaly aims to purchase peanuts every week from wholesalers at the Konobougou market. She sells peanut paste in the village and at the Konobougou market for cash or credit sales to a customer base mainly made up of women. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to pay for healthcare, food and school expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing peanuts

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana de 27 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, posee una panadería, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, hace cinco años tiene el negocio, trabajan junto a su esposo en la preparación del pan y para la venta le ayudan sus hijos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales para la panadería como harina, levadura, azúcar, para la preparación del pan, con este préstamo estará adquiriendo más material para el inventario y para aumentar su producción.
Con el presente crédito quiere realizar una buena administración de los fondos y con las ganancias pagar puntualmente las cuotas, así también en futuro ampliar la panadería y atender a nuevas zonas.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old and she lives in Jiquilisco, in the region of Usulutan. She has a bakery. She lives together with her husband and children. She has had her business for the past five years. She works with her husband making bread and her children help out with the sales.

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients for the bakery, such as: flour, yeast and sugar. This will will be used to acquire more ingredients for their inventory and it will help increase production. 

With this loan she wants to administr the funds soundly and she will use the profits to pay back the loan on time. In the future she will expand her bakery and to cater to new locales.

loans.use: Compra de harina, levadura, azúcar

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guadalupe; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carne, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado, ella atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio, ahora que se acercan las fiestas navideñas venderá carne de cerdo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne de cerdo al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guadalupe belongs to the “COMUZONE I” Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco. 

She is 34 years old, living with her partner and has 3 children. Guadalupe's daily activity centers on her meat-selling business. She has a post in the market which she attends from 5:00 am until 6:00 pm. Guadalupe wants to expand and improve her business. Now that the Christmas season is approaching she will sell more pork. She is requesting the loan to buy pork at wholesale.

Guadalupe is happy with the loan and she promises to comply with the terms of repayment.

loans.use: TO BUY PORK AT WHOLESALE TO SELL

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Yamadibougou, sous-préfecture de Konobougou; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des articles de boutique, ustensiles en plastique et du savon.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.
AWA M. s’approvisionne en articles de boutique presque hebdomadairement au marché de Konobougou. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo group are all married, 35 years old with three children each; they all live in large extended families in the village of Yamadibougou, the district of Konobougou, in the Ségou region (the fourth largest region of the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family links and sell plastic utensils and soap for a living.  
The women are on their ninth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 
Awa M. sources her goods almost weekly from the Konobougou market. She sells her wares in the village for cash and credit sales to a customer base made up of men and women. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to pay for healthcare, food and school expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing various items for her shop

loans.name: María

texts.es: María de 42 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 2 pequeños hijos; sola ha tenido que sacar adelante a sus hijos; es por esta razón que tiene muchas ganas de progresar. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica, desde hace 15 años, a la fabricación de toda clase de bijouteria, elaborada a base de diversas semillas de la sierra y selva de su país. Le gusta mucho su labor pues mientras trabaja puede educar a sus hijos sin problemas; cuando deja a su pequeño en el colegio inicial regresa a su casa a empezar a trabajar y así continua todo el día, de lunes a sábado. Además como su producción de aretes, collares y pulseras se exporta a otro país, también les ha brindado trabajo a algunas amigas de la zona donde vive, y les entrega de a pocos las semillas que compra para que acaben con  los grandes pedidos que tiene a tiempo. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un restaurante de comidas típicas, pero sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lo logrará. Es el 13avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues como es un cliente antiguo no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de semillas, para concretar un pedido que tiene pendiente, de esta manera espera continuar adelante para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and lives in her own house beside her 2 small children. She has had to advance her children alone; that's why she has much desire to progress. This enterprising woman has been dedicated for some 15 years to making all kinds of trinkets, using diverse types of seeds from the mountains and jungles of her country.

She enjoys the work, since while working, she can educate her children without problems. After dropping off her youngest at school, she returns home and begins to work, and so it is from Monday until Saturday. In addition to making earrings, necklaces, and bracelets, which are exported to other countries, she has provided work for some of her friends in the zone where she lives. They bring her the seeds that she needs in order to fulfill her large orders on time. Since she is an enterprising woman, her future plans include installation of a restaurant serving typical local foods. And she knows that with much effort, it will be achieved. 

This is her 13th loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually. Since she is an frequent client, she does not wish to create a bad impression on the people who made possible this opportunity to continue working in quest of progress.

Maria plans to invest the solicited loan in buying a quantity of seeds to fulfill an order she has pending. In this manner, she hopes to forge ahead, complying with her goals.

loans.use: TO BUY SEEDS FOR MAKING EARRINGS, NECKLACES AND BRACELETS TO SELL

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l'Ouémé, Colette est mariée à Christophe, un mécanicien, et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, trois sont à la charge du couple. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Colette s'est installée avec sa famille à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Colette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a dix ans que Colette vend de façon ambulante de la friperie. De façon secondaire, Colette vend du charbon de bois à son domicile. Colette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Colette sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé district, Colette is married to Christophe, a mechanic, and is the mother of four children who are all at school; three of the children are in the couple's care.  Around ten years ago, Colette moved to  Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji district. The couple see to the family's needs together. Colette did not attend school.
Colette has sold second-hand clothes from door to door for ten years, and also sells charcoal from her home. She purchases her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market.  It is the second time that she has sought a loan from ALIDé, in order to boost her business and better meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: Purchasing second-hand clothes and charcoal

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.es:
Doña Martha D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en Gualococti departamento D. Morazán, venD. cosméticos y ropa, vive con su esposo y una nieta, posee más D. ocho años D. dedicarse a este negocio, y trabaja D. 8:00am a 2:00pm, la dificultad D. doña Martha es que debe salir a ofrecer la ropa y los cosméticos a los vecinos del lugar en busca D. vender y D. ganar clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo que necesita para comprar mercadería y surtir el negocio como blusas, faldas, ropa interior, trajes para niños, esta inversión la realiza para atraer a los clientes y aprovechar el tiempo D. regalar en estas fiestas D. fin D. año, donD. las personas compran para obsequiar.
Sueña con ampliar el negocio e instalar un cafetín en el centro escolar D. Gualococti para generar aun más ganancias y poder cancelar oportunamente el préstamo.
texts.en:
Martha, 52, lives in Gualococti in the department of Morazán. She lives with her husband and one granddaughter. For more than eight years she has operated a business selling cosmetics and clothing. She works from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm. The difficulty she has is that she must go out to look for clients. 

Martha is seeking this loan to buy merchandise and stock the business. She will buy blouses, skirts, underwear, and childrens' clothing. This investment will help attract clients and take advantage of holiday gift-giving season. 

Martha’s dream is to grow her business and install a food sales business in a school zone in Gualococti. This would generate even more earnings and help pay off the loan.

loans.use: Buy blouses, skirts, underwear, and childrens' clothing.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María, tiene 47 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su dos hijos, Patricia de 22 años, Roberto de 13 años de edad, además de su esposo José Valerio, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 6 años, trabaja junto a su hermana y su hija desde las 5:00am a 12:00md, aprendió a preparar pupusas por su hermana mayor.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para adecuar el local y materia prima como chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, estos son los principales productos para preparar las pupusas, además de comprar mesas y sillas para ampliar la atención adecuada a los clientes.
La aspiración principal es generar ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar y pagar este préstamo, ayudar a sus hijos y en especial a su hija mayor en la búsqueda de empleo.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and she lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the region of Morazan. She lives together with her two children, Patricia, 22, and Roberto, 13, and her husband Jose Valerio. She sells pupusas. It is a business she has had for the past 6 years. She works together with her sister and her daufther from 5 a.m. until midnight. She learned how to prepare pupusas from her eldest sister.

She requests a loan to purchase things that she needs to furnish her restaurant and to purchase ingredients, such as pork meat, cheese, and corn. These are the main ingredients used to prepare pupusas. She also wants to purchase tables and chairs in order to provide her clients with an adequate level of attention. 

Her goal is to generate enough income to cover the household expenses and to pay for this loan. She wants to help her children, especially her eldest daughter who is currently looking for work.

loans.use: To expand her store and to purchase atables and chairs, and ingredients.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Yamadibougou, préfecture de Barouéli, sous-préfecture de Konobougou; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des articles de boutique, du sel et de la farine de blé                                                                                  
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des articles de boutique, du sel et de la farine de blé.                                                                         
INDA S. s’approvisionne en articles de boutique presque hebdomadairement au marché de Konobougou. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group are all married. On average, they are 35 years old and have 3 children. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Yamadibougou, prefecture of Barouéli, sub-prefecture of Konobougou in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region  of the Republic of Mali).

They met through family ties and are engaged in the sale of shop goods, salt and wheat flower. The women of the Tiessiri group are on their ninth loan, which will be used to purchase shop goods, salt and wheat flower.    
                                                                              
INDA S. gets her supplies of shop goods almost every a week at the Konobougou market. She sells the goods in the village center, for cash or credit, to a customer base of women and men.

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs that will be used to pay the loan installments, to cover health, food and schooling expenses, the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To purchase various shop goods

loans.name: Emilda

texts.es:
Emilda  solicito 500 $us. Trabaja como peinadora en su salón de peinados, su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. Vive en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene tres hijos pequeños.

El crédito lo destinara para  amurallar un pequeño  terreno el cual lo adquirió recientemente. Es el tercer  crédito en impro y el segundo vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Emilda requests a loan of US$500. She works as a hairdresser in a beauty salon. Her husband works in the interior region of the country. She lives in the region called Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. She has three small children. 

The loan will be used to build a wall around a small plot of land that she recently acquired. This is the third loan she accesses through Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and the second through Kiva.

loans.use: To build a wall around a plot of land.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eusebia; ella tiene 52 años D. edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. ropa, ella venD. diferentes tipos D. ropa en forma ambulatoria, ella la mercadería lo trae D. diferentes lugares como Bolivia y Chile, la socia quiere tenr una tienda para vender los polos, pantalones, blusas entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para el negocio D. venta D. ropa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the community bank named "Comuzone I". The community bank is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco. 

The member's name is Eusebia. She is 52 years old, she is married and she has 2 children. She has a clothing retail business through which she sells various types of clothing along the streets. She brings her merchandise from different places such as Bolivia and Chile. She would like to have a store from where to sell polo shirts, slacks, blouses etc. She requests a loan in order to purchase merchandise for her clothing retail business.

She is very happy to receive a loan and she is committed to the payment terms of her loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Katia Deyanina

texts.es:
Katia es una mujer muy dedicada a su hijo,  siendo madre soltera, posee su propio negocio una pulpería que con ayuda de su mama y con financiamiento en Afodenic, sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad de productos, lo que ha venido a incrementar su clientela.
A pesar de que no cuenta con ayuda del padre de su hijo, no ha sido un octaculo para lograr salir adelante, lo mejor es que sus padres la han apoyado, viviendo aun con ellos y creciendo con su negocio.
Con este nuevo préstamo será para la inversión de productos de consumo en la compra de carne, pollo, productos lácteos, golosinas, gaseosas, productos enlatados, ya que se vende más, y rota más su dinero. Siendo su objetivo aumentar sus ganancias para lograr satisfacer sus compromisos personales.
texts.en:
Katia is a single mother who is devoted to her son. She runs her own grocery store and with the help of her mother and financing from Afodenic, she has been able to offer a greater variety of products which has increased her sales and her clientele.

Even though Katia does not receive support from the father of her child, this has not stopped her from moving forward with her life. The best thing for her has been the support of her parents, who she still lives with, and the expansion of her business.

Katia will use this new loan to purchase meat, chicken, canned goods, sweets and dairy products, as the more sales she makes, the further her money goes. Her goal is to increase her income to meet her personal commitments.

loans.use: Purchase meat, chicken, canned goods, sweets and dairy products.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, des boissons et  de la restauration.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des boissons en sucrerie (BRAMALI), des condiments pour la restauration et des  habillements.                                   
FATOUMATA M., qui est la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des boissons non alcoolisées avec les grossistes de la place. Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement au poste de contrôle à la sortie de la ville de Fana en partance pour Bamako, au comptant, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de passagers.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi Group, all married, have an average age of 39 years and an average of three children each. They all live together in a traditional extended family in the town of Fana in the Banankabougou area of the Dioïla district in Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They know each other through family ties and the clothing, drinks and restaurant businesses they run.

The women of the Benkadi group are on their eighth group loan which will be used to purchase soft drinks (called BRAMALI), condiments for the restaurant and clothes.

FATOUMATA M., the president of the group, plans on using her part of the loan to buy non-alcoholic drinks from wholesalers. She sells her produce for cash every day at the checkpoint at the Bamako exit of the town of Fana, to a customer base made up largely of passengers.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA which will be used to pay back the loan, contribute to healthcare costs, food bills, school fees and the rest she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: The purchase of non-alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, D. 40 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. pupusas como fuente D. ingresos para su hogar, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, ella vive con sus cuatro hijos: Rony D. 18 años, Nilson D. 17, Wilson D. 13, José Miguel D. 4 años D. edad, es madre soltera, y tiene cinco años D. dedicarse a la venta, con un horario D. 5:00am a 11:am, todos los días D. la semana, inicio gracias a su madre que le enseño la preparación D. los ingredientes para poder hacer las pupusas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. una cocina con plancha y también ingredientes para la venta, como tomates, cebollas, maíz, chiles entre otros que son necesarios para la preparación D. las pupusas, esta inversión le ayudara a generar más ingresos a su hogar y a brindar un mejor servicio y atención a los clientes.
Su objetivo es ser buen cliente pagando en las fechas establecidas, ahorrar D. las ganancias para mejorar la vivienda y seguir velando por el bienestar D. sus hijos que continúen estudiando hasta que logren terminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 40 years old and she sells pupusas. It is a source of income for her household. She lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the Morazan region. She lives with her four children: Rony, 18; Nilson, 17; Wilson, 13; and, Jose Miguel, 4. She is a single mother and she has had her business for the past five years. She works from 5:00am to 11am every day of the week. She started out thanks to her mother who taught her how to prepare the ingredients to make pupusas.

She requests a loan to purchase a stove with a grill surface and to purchase ingredients, including: tomatoes, onions, corn, hot peppers, and other ingredients that are necessary to make pupusas. This investment will help her generate more income for her household and to proviD. better service and attention to her clients.

Her goal is to be a good client and to make payments in the dates that were agreed on, to save money to improve their home, and to keep working hard for the welfare of her children, to keep them in school until they graduate from university.

loans.use: To purchase a stove and ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Ernedz

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ernedz; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte y con el negocio de venta de camisas, el socio se dedica a transporte, el es propietario de una combi que hace servicio público, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de transporte. El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the community bank "Comuzone I". It is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco. 

The member's name is Ernedz. He is 45 years old, he is married and he has 2 children. He has a public transport business and a retail t-shirt business. He owns a minivan with which he offers public transport services. He wants to improve his transport business. He requests a loan to carry out some maintenance repairs to his van.

He is very happy for the loan and he is committed to payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: To carry out maintenace repairs to his van.

loans.name: F. Joséphine

texts.fr: Née en 1965, F. Joséphine vit depuis une trentaine d'année à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Joséphine est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Jean-Mari. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant ensemble avec leurs parents. Joséphine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et satisfaire ses enfants, Joséphine mène comme activité la vente de produits divers (pâtes alimentaires, savons, couscous, allumettes, dentifrices, oeufs, farine de manioc, huile végétale, etc.) et des produits vivriers (maïs, riz, etc.) à son domicile. Joséphine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Joséphine mène cette activité depuis dix sept ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre à ses besoins et de nourrir sa famille. C'est la première fois que Joséphine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, ce qui lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Josephine was born in 1965 and she has lived in Ekpe for thirty years, in a community in Seme-Podji in Benin. Josephine is married to a tailor named Jean-Mari. The couple has five children together and they are all attending school and live at home with them. Josephine did not go to school. In order to provide for the needs of her children, Josephine has a general store installed in her home selling pastas, soaps, couscous, matches, toothpaste, eggs, flour, vegetable oil, as well as products from the harvest, such as corn and rice. Josephine purchases her products in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Josephine has had her business for seventeen years and it has helped to support her family and to keep them fed. This is the first time that Josephine requests a loan from Alide (Kiva Field Partner). This loan will help her strengthen her business and she will be able to better meet client demands.

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 45 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa Mery de 46 años y de sus 3 hijas menores, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante en busca del progreso.
