Este emprendedor hombre se desempeña como obrero de construcción civil y desde muy joven aprendió todas las técnica necesarias que le permitieron continuar con su labor sin problemas. Luego de algunos años la experiencia le ha permitido llegar a ser maestro de construcción, y en la actualidad labora, con un amigo, en  grandes obras, cuyos ingenieros los contratan por temporadas. Le gusta mucho terminar las obras y ver el gran esfuerzo plasmado en una sólida construcción, lo que no le gusta es que su vivienda esta algo alejada de la ciudad, por lo que debe salir todos los días desde la madrugada para llegar a tiempo. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor tiene planeado para el futuro instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa, y para lograrlo desea terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues esta muy agradecido con las personas que hicieron posible que continúe con sus proyectos. Juan tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción (cemento, arena, ladrillos, entre otros) pues tiene pensado construir 3 muros de material noble para empezar a refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en: Juan, who is 45 years old, lives in his own house with his 46 year old wife Mery and their 3 young daughters. Together they strive every day to get ahead in search of a better life. This enterprising man is a civil construction worker, and from a young age learned all the necessary skills to continue this work without problems. After a number of years, this experience has made him a master of construction. Today he works with a friend on large projects, whose engineers hire them temporarily. He really enjoys finishing a project and seeing all his efforts embodied in a strong building. What he doesn't enjoy is that his home is somewhat removed from the city, so that he has to leave at dawn every day in order to arrive on time. Since he is a rather enterprising man, he plans in the future to start a grocery store in his house, and to do this he wants to finish building his house with high quality materials. This is his second loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments on time. He is very grateful to the people who made it possible for him to continue with his projects. Juan plans to invest the amount asked for in purchasing construction materials (including cement, sand, and bricks) as he intends to build 3 walls from quality materials as a start on refurbishing his home.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building his home.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es soltera  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende diferentes tipos de ropa en forma ambulatoria, ella la mercadería lo trae de diferentes lugares como Bolivia y Chile, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los polos, pantalones, blusas entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para el negocio de venta de ropa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "COMUZONE I."  The bank is located in the Cusco district and is a part of the Cusco province and Cusco department.
The member is la Señora Mercedes; she is 36, single, and has two children.  Working every other day, she sells different types of clothing by taking her wares to her customers.  She obtains the merchandise from different places such as Bolivia and Chile.  She would like to have a store to sell Polo shirts, pants, blouses, and other items.  She requests this loan to buy merchandise for her business.
Mercedes is happy with this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: The member requests this loan to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouma, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de charbon de bois, de bois de chauffe et la vente des cartes de crédit téléphonique.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouma sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire et  FRANCOISE T., compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des cartes de crédit de recharge téléphonique, régulièrement avec les grossistes de la place.  Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement à son domicile au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes passagers.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Dembagnouma  group are all married, are on average 44 years old with three children, and live in traditional extended families in the city of Fana, in the Banankabougou district, in the Dioïla prefecture of the Region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The know each other through family ties and are involved in the business of selling charcoal, firewood and telephone cards. 

The women of the Dembagnouma  group  are on their eighth group loan and FRANCOISE T. plans to use her loan to buy rechargeable telephone cards on a regular basis from the wholesalers in her area.  She makes her sales daily from her home for cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women. 

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA which will be used to repay the loan, cover health related expenses, and pay for food and school expenses, with the rest being  reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy telephone cards

loans.name: Maria Rosalina

texts.es:
María, resiD. en San Simón departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad, tiene 32 años D. edad, está casada pero aun no tiene hijos, este negocio tiene más D. seis años D. existir con un horario D. 6:00am a 7:00pm lo atienD., actualmente necesita compra mercadería para asistir al inventario y dotarlo D. mercadería para uso domestico.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, papel higiénico, con esta ayuda el negocio será fortalecido para atender la demanda  D. los clientes brindando un buen servicio. El objetivo D. María es realizar una buena inversión, surtir el negocio con todo lo necesario para satisfacer la necesidad del cliente, desarrollar la familia con hijos y velar por el bienestar D. ellos.
texts.en:
María lives in the San Simón department of Morazán.  She sells basic, essential items.  She is 32, married, but does not yet have children.  Her business is more than six years old, and she works from 6am to 7pm.  She now needs to purchase merchandise for inventory.
She requests this loan to invest in merchandise such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, and bathroom tissue.  With this loan, the business will be well-equipped and able to meet the needs of customers.  The goals of María are to make a good investment, supply her business with everything necessary to satisfy her customers, and to have children and care for them.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, and bathroom tissue

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoraida; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de flores, ella tiene un puesto pequeño en el mercado El Molino, ella atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de flores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar flores al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Comuzone I" communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Zoraida, who is 32 years old, single, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and a business selling flowers.  She has a small stand in the El Molino market, which she tends from 9:00 a.m to 5:00 p.m.  Zoraida would like to improve and expand her business, so she has requested this loan in order to buy flowers wholesale.

Ms. Zoraida is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy flowers wholesale

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements et  de la restauration.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
AMINATA S., qui est un membre du groupe compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habillements. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Fana pendant les jours de foire hebdomadaires. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement de porte en porte au niveau de la ville, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Djiguiya group are all married, are on average 40 years old with four children, and live in traditional extended families in the city of Fana, in the Banankabougou district, in the Dioïla prefecture of the Region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through family ties and are involved in selling clothing and food service.
The women of Djiguiya group are on their first joint loan through Soro Yiriwaso.
AMINATA S., a member of the group, plans to use her loan to buy clothing.  She gets her supplies at the market in Fana during the weekly market days.  She makes her sales daily from door to door in the city, for cash and on credit, to a clientele of women and men. 
She hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA which will be used to pay the interest on the loan,  cover health related expenses, and pay for food and school expenses, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Los Pinos Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “LOS PINOS” está iniciando su ciclo número uno en el Centro Focal de LOS ANDES. Cuenta con trece integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Olga, la tesorera, la señora Cristina y como secretaria de actas la señora Mary Cruz.  Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio, producción  y servicio, como ser: venta de mantas y polleras, taller de calzados de cholita, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, tejidos a mano con groché y machiné, tejido de prendas de lana, venta de coca, pinado de cuadros, tejido de chompas tienda surtida venta de flores, venta de de verduras.

La señora  Olga presidenta de la B.C. “Los Pinos”, esta casada y es madre de tres hijos.
Hace cuatro años, su mamá le enseñó a tejer a mano chompas y ropa para bebé. Ella mantiene este trabajo por que le permite quedarse en su domicilio, al mismo tiempo que trabaja puede realizar las tareas de su hogar y/o apoyar a sus hijos.  Las ventas son realizadas en la feria 16 de Julio los días jueves y domingo y también viaja a Desaguadero, una localidad cercana, fronteriza con el vecino país del Perú.
texts.en:
The community bank "Los Pinos" is on its first loan cycle and it is located in Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of thirteen members. The management of the group is made up of the leader, Olga, the treasurer, Cristina, and the secretary is Mary Cruz. The members' business are  related to commerce, production, and service, such as:  clothing retail, cobbler, convenience  store, knitting, wool clothing, sale of coca leaves, art sales, flower sales, and the sale of  produce.

Olga is the leader of the community bank "Los Pinos". She is married and she is the mother of three children. Four years ago her mother taught her how to knight sweaters and baby clothes by hand. She has kept up the business because she is able to work from home. She is therefore able to do the household chores and she can also take care of her kids. She sells her products in the market called 16 de Julio, on Thursdays and Sundays. But she also travels to Desaguadero, a nearby location that is near the border of the neighboring country of Peru.

loans.use: To purchase wool yarn.

loans.name: Together Towards Progress Group

texts.es:
L. socia pertenece al banco comunal  “JUNTOS PARA EL PROGRESO”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

L. socia es L. Sra. Esmircinia; L. socia tiene 26 años D. edad, L. socia tiene 1 hijo, y elL. se dedica al comercio minorista, L. socia compra al por mayor zapatillas, elL. viaja a diferentes ciudad en diferentes fechas del año y trae zapatillas, D. diferentes tallas y modelos, elL. ahora desea traer su siguiente campaña para el año que viene y surtir su mercadería. L. socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatillas al por mayor.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes tareas como por ejemplo en su mayoría son comerciantes minoristas, estos socios compran y venden ropa, también venden cosméticos por catálogos, y dos socias venden huevos cocidos D. codorniz. Los socias invertirán su dinero en L. compra D. sus mercaderías como capital D. trabajo. 

L. socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the community bank named "Together towards Progress”. The community bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and region of Cusco. 

The member's name is Esmircinia. She is 26 years old and she has a son. She is a retailer who buys dress shoes in wholesale. She travels to various cities at during the year to purchase shoes of different sizes and models.  She wants to start a new campaign for the New Year and to add variety to her inventory. She requests a loan to purchase shoes in wholesale.

Each of the members has a different business, though the majority of them are retailers who buy and sell clothing and cosmetics through catalogues. Two of the members sell cooked quail eggs. The members will invest the funds in the purchase of merchandise for their business.

Esmircinia values the loan and she is committed to the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in wholesale.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Felix; el tiene 40 años de edad y es divorciado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura y también es contador, el socio tiene un pequeños terrenos donde cultiva maíz y papa, el socio quiere mejorar las tierras de cultivo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the community bank "Comuzone I". It is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco. 

The member's name is Felix. He is 40 years old, he is divorced, and he has a son. He is an agriculturist and accountant. He has small plots of land where he cultivates potatoes and corn. He wants to improve his fields. He requests a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation. 

He is very happy with the loan and he is committed to the payment terms.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 30 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, des condiments, du lait et du savon                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des habillements, des condiments, du lait et du savon                                                                         
AMINATA S. s’approvisionne en condiments au marché de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of Laïdou group are all married, are on average 30 years old with five children, and live in traditional extended families in the Banankabougou district of  the city of Fana, in the Dioïla prefecture of the Region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through family ties and are in the business of selling clothing, condiments, milk and soap.
The women of Laïdou group are on their sixth joint loan which will be used to buy clothing, condiments,  milk and soap.
AMINATA S. gets her supplies of condiments at the market in Fana.   She makes her sales daily from her home, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed mainly of women.
She plans to make a monthly profit of 25,000 CFA which will be used to pay the interest on the  loan and to pay for contributions to social ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her business of selling condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagro, reside en San Miguel, tiene 35 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tostadas, vive con su esposo y una hija de 16 años de edad, este negocio fue fundado junto con su esposo desde hace 10 años, el horario de vender es de 3:00pm a 7:00pm, todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para incrementar su negocio a través de la compran de quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, entre otros productos para hacer las pupusas ya que desea producir más para ofrecer a los clientes.
El objetivo de Milagro es mantenerse en el negocio por largo tiempo, ir aumentando sus ventas para sacar a delante a su hija y que en el futuro sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Milagro lives in San Miguel. She is 35 years old and she sells pupusas and tostadas. She lives with her husband and their 16-year old daughter. She started her business together with her husband 10 years ago. They sell from 3pm to 7pm every day of the week. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business with the purchase of ingredients, such as cheese, pork meats, corn, and other ingredients necessary to make pupusas. She wants to increase production in order to offer more to her clients.

Milagro's goal is to keep her business for the long run, to increase her sales and to support her daughter so that in the future she will have a professional career.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, pork meat, and corn.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo de 40 años, era comerciante ambulante de queso y maní pero como no tenía mucha rentabilidad en esta actividad económica decidió retirarse y comenzar una que pueda trabajar conjunto a su esposa (aparece en la foto). 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio esta actualmente trabajando con ayuda de su esposa en un puesto de comida que los dos pusieron para poder mantener a sus tres hijos de 19, 15 y 17 años. Vende comida desde las 05h00am hasta las 13h00pm en un puesto. Una de las complicaciones de vender comida en la calle es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde tiene el negocio de comidas. 

Marcelo ya tiene 20 años casado con su esposa por eso quiere seguir trabajando junto con ella en un negocio mutuo por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, sillas, mesas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un local para su negocio de comidas y seguir con ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 40 years old and he once was a merchant who sold cheese and potatoes but since his sales were not very good he decided to stop. He wanted a business that he and his wife could work together (she is in the photograph).

They live in an urban region called Suburbio. He works together with his wife running a food stall that they both own. They support their three children, aged 19, 15, and 17. He sells from 5am to 1pm from their stall. One of the challenges their business faces is the crime that their district suffers.

Marcelo has been married for 20 years with his wife and he wants to keep working with her on their business. He wants to purchase rice, chairs, and tables for their business. In the future he wants to have a restaurant and to keep earning the income enough to support the family.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, tables, and rice.

loans.name: Aurore

texts.fr: Aurore est née le 09 Août 1979 et vit depuis sa naissance à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à un Marcelin, Aurore est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Aurore vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Aurore a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et s'est lancée dans le commerce d'ustensiles de cuisine (glacières, seaux en plastique etc.) par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Aurore vend également des pâtes alimentaires. Aurore s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Aurore exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. C'est la première fois que Aurore sollicite un concours financier auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en: Aurore was born on August 9, 1979, and has  lived in Ekpè all her life, in the town of Sèmè-Podji.  Married to  Marcelin, Aurore is the mother of three children, all of whom attend school.  She lives with her husband and children.  Together, the couple meet their various family expenses.  Aurore left school at the secondary level and became involved in the business of selling kitchen equipment (coolers, plastic buckets, etc.) through the local distribution system.  As a sideline, Aurore also sells pasta.  She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin.  Aurore has been doing this kind of work for seven years.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan through ALIDé, with the intention of growing her business and increasing her revenue.

loans.use: to purchase plastic kitchen equipment

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de gallinas y cuyes, ella vende en la forma ambulatoria en cualquier de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los animales y luego los vende. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas y cuyes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the “COMUZONE I” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Alejandrina is 39 years old, married and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising chickens and guinea pigs.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor in the markets in the city of Cusco's.  She fattens her animals and, when they are grown, she sells them.  She is requesting this loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

Alejandrina is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta P. sells smoked fish at Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a palm wine tapper. 

Atta has been selling smoked fish for twelve years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Demand for her kenkey is high and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profit. She will use the loan to buy more fish for sale. 

She hopes to buy land using her expanded capital.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Originally from Cuba, Jesus was employed at a corporate cleaning service but with the birth of his 19-month-old daughter, he decided that it was time to take his financial future into this own hands. He is currently the manager of his own night cleaning service. With the help of his wife, he has begun to build a reputable cleaning service. Together they have worked hard to build the number of clients the business services and improve the quality of their service. 

With this loan from ACCION USA , Jesus will be paying franchising fees for his business and truly establishing himself as his own boss. This will also enable him to solidify his credit history for the future when he is finally able to expand his business. 

Jesus’ hope is that he will be able to grow his business enough that he can quit his second job as an airport driver and spend more time with his growing family. Beyond supporting his family Jesus also wants to be able have a strong reputation in his community as a formidable businessman. 


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions like ACCION USA support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To finance his nighttime cleaning venture

loans.name: Timinandja Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Timinandja, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de tubercules, de l’arachide des condiments et des habillements. Les femmes du groupe Timinandja sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                              
TATA T. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des tubercules.                                                                     
Elle s’approvisionne en tubercules au marché de Fana pendant les jours de foire. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de tubercules.
texts.en:
The women of the Timinandja group are all married, are on average 40 years old with four children, and live in traditional extended families in the Banankabougou district of the city of Fana, in the Dioïla prefecture of the Region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through family ties and are in the business of selling tubers, peanuts, condiments and clothing. The women of the Timinandja group are on their first joint loan with Soro Yiriwaso.
TATA T. plans to use her loan to buy tubers. She gets her supply of tubers at the market in Fana during market days.  She makes her sales daily from her home for cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women. 
She plans to make a monthly profit of 20,000 CFA which will be used to pay interest on the loan and  to make contributions to social ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her tuber business.

loans.use: to buy tubers

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca de 37 años de edad, se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura vive con sus hijos y su esposo, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, ella junto a su esposo desarrolla lo que es la agricultura y atender al ganado ya que es un trabajo fuerte para desarrollarlo una mujer.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para compra de abono para la siembra de maíz, este préstamo le facilitara la obtención de lo necesario para realizar la siembra.
Blanca espera realzar un buen cultivo y recoger buena cosecha para dar alimentación a su familia y continuar trabajando con su esposo por el bienestar del hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca id 37 years old.  She farms livestock and crops.  She lives with her husband and children in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  Together with her husband she farms her crops and looks after her livestock since it is difficult work for a woman.

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy manure for her corn crops.  She will use the loan to buy what she needs in order to sow her crops.  She hopes that her crops will grow well and that she will have a good harvest so that she can feed her family and continue working with her husband for the well-being of her household.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers so that she can sow her corn

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Raul; el tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte y también el socio es abogado, con respecto a su negocio de transporte el socio tiene un bus que hace servicio público a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar combustible y mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Raul is a member of the “COMUZONE I” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Raul is 41 years old.  He lives with his partner and has two children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his transport business.  He is also a lawyer.  As regards his transport business, Raul has a bus with which he provides a public transport service in the city of Puerto Maldonado.  Through this business, he gets his children ahead in life.  He is requesting this loan to buy fuel and pay for maintenance work on his vehicle.

Raul is happy to be receiving this loan and he pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy fuel and to have maintenance work done on his vehicle

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer emprendedora, casada y con tres hermosos hijos. Hoy en día tiene su propia venta de fritanga desde hace 6 años, lo que ha venido  vendiendo y captando cliente.
Empezando con poca venta y poco menú ya que inicio con poco ahorro, lo que vino a mejorar atreves del financiamiento ya que compro más productos para hacer más comida, más variedad en los platillos. Teniendo el apoyo de su esposo que labora como conductor.
Con los créditos ha logrado comprar mesas y sillas de plásticos, un techo para estar en mejores condiciones, pero que aún le falta lo que terminara de poner las láminas de zinc, piedra, arena, cemento para hacer arranque e ir cerrando y tener mejor espacio e higiene en su servicio de venta de comida.
texts.en: Luisa is an enterprising woman, married with three handsome sons. She currently has her own fritanga [Mexican fried food] store, which she has had for 6 years. She has been selling and capturing clientele. She began with a small amount of savings, starting with small sales and a small menu which improved with financing, since she bought more products to make more food and have more variety in her dishes. She has the support of her husband who works as a driver. With her loans, she has been able to purchase plastic tables and chairs, and a roof to have better conditions, but she still needs to finish putting in zinc sheets, stone, sand and cement for the base and close it off in order to have a better space and greater hygiene in her food sales service.

loans.use: She will purchase sheets of zinc, blocks, sand, and cement. In order to be able to close up the space where she sells and provide a better service.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora, de 37 años, es un responsable madre soltera de 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos Yerson, de 17, Gina, de 13 y Kelly, de 8 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos vive en su casa propia, ubicada en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). Está trabajadora mujer, se dedica a la agricultura sus principales cultivos constan de piña y una variedad de cítricos, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia, y según ella eso le valió para poder abrirse al mercado de la capital, donde los productos de buena calidad y buen precio son los más adquiridos. Una vez al año Aurora, cosecha en gran escala sus frutos, mientras que cada semana cosecha su producción de piña, por ello constantemente tiene que viajar a la capital. Pero la tenacidad que la caracteriza hace que invierta en la mejora de sus cultivos. Ahora ella ya comenzó con al abono constante y escalonado, con ello asegura que su producción dará frutos similares, con la misma calidad y sobre todo muy nutritivos. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y espera seguir trabajando con los miembros de su banco comunal, que son personas serias y muy responsables. Con el crédito solicitado, ha pensado comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Aurora is 37 years old.  She is a responsible single mother with 4 children.  She lives with three of her children: 17 year-old Yerson, 13 year-old Gina and 8 year-old Kelly.  They live in their own home in Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (in the Peruvian central jungle).

This hard-working woman is a farmer.  Her main crops are pineapples and a range of citrus fruits.  She has 15 years' experience and she says that this helps her to sell her products in the market in the capital where good-quality and well-priced products sell the best.

Once a year, Aurora harvests her fruit on a grand scale whilst her pineapples are harvested every week.  This means that she constantly has to travel to the capital.  However, the tenacity that characterizes Aurora means that she invests in improving her crops.  She is currently starting with constant, staggered applications of manure.  With this, she is certain that she will produce similar fruit of the same quality and, above all, fruit that is very nutritious.

This is Aurora's sixth loan with MFP and she hopes to continue working with the members of her community bank who are serious and very responsible people.  She is planning to use her loan to buy several sacks of organic manure for her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reina, resiD. en Jiquilisco, departamento D. Usulután, tiene 53 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, tienen casa propia, se dedica a una tienda donD. ofrece artículos D. primera necesidad, dicho negocio tiene 18 años D. existir manteniéndose por su buena administración.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para la tienda, D. esta manera estará ofreciendo a los clientes mejores productos y más para atender la demanda.
Este préstamo le dará estabilidad al negocio y continuara con él por largo tiempo, D. esta manera seguirá aportando al hogar ingresos que ayudan para cubrir gastos y necesidades D. sus hijos y D. ella.
texts.en:
Reina lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  She is 53 years old and lives with her husband and two children.  They have their own home and Reina has a store where she sells essentials. Her business has been going for 18 years thanks to her good running of it.

Reina is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her store.  This will allow her to offer more and better products to her customers so that she can meet their demand.

This loan will proviD. Reina's business with stability and she will continue with her business for a long time.  This will allow her to continue providing income for her household that helps to cover her own expenses and needs as well as those of her children.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Carlos; el tiene 48 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de pollos y cuyes en Yanatile que queda ubicado en la provincia de Calca que es a una hora de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio también se dedica a la docencia enseñando en un instituto, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de crianza de pollos y cuyes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y pollos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a member of the "COMUZONE I” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Juan Carlos is 48 years old, married and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business raising chickens and guinea pigs in Yanatile, which is in Calca province, one hour from the city of Cusco.  He also teaches in a school.  Juan Carlos would like to improve and expand his business raising chickens and guinea pigs.  He is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Juan Carlos is happy to be receiving a loan and he pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Don Mauro, tiene 47 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, además de la agricultura también atiende la ganadería y comercializa reces cada quince días, siembra dos manzanas de terreno, esta es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta el hogar de don Mauro.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes, con esta ayuda podrá realizar la siembra y dar un buen cuido al desarrollo de la milpa, esperando tener cosecha abundante.
Don Mauro tiene por objetivo el realizar una buena siembra, ayudar con estos ingresos a su familia y continuar en el trabajo de campo para que su familia cuente con la alimentación necesaria.
texts.en:
Mauro is a 47 year old farmer.  He lives with his wife and children in Jiquilisco, located in the Usulután department.  Apart from farming, he also raises livestock and sells cattle every two weeks.  He plants on two plots of land.  This is the income on which Mauro’s household depends on.

He is asking for a loan so he can buy farming supplies and fertilizers.  This will allow him to develop his field in hopes of having an abundant harvest.

Mauro has the objective of having a good harvest, help his family with this income, and continue working in the fields so that his family will have the food they need.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marilu; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda fotográfica, ella atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda fotográfica. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar rollos para la cámara.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “COMUZONE I” communal bank. The bank is located in the Cuzco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco. 

The member's name is Marilu. She is 37 years old and in a common law marriage. She has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with running a photography store. She works from 9 :00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. With this business, she is getting her children ahead. She wants to enlarge the photography store and is asking for the loan to buy camera film.  

The member is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy camera film.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, D. 59 años, está casada con Sebastian, D. 73 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 D. ellos: Mállela D. 7 y Mayveli, D. 4 años D. edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). DesD. hace 15 años, está trabajadora mujer tuvo una excelente idea. Cada día pasaba frente a la catarata más reconocida del Perú “Tirol”, y pensó que podía poner un negocio D. venta D. comestibles, entre bebidas, dulces y artesanía; es entonces que reunió todas sus fuerzas en construir una choza pequeña, pero adornada con motivos D. la localidad. Por mucho tiempo tuvo buenas ganancias, “yo bauticé la catarata con negocio, pero después apareció la competencia”, afirma. Pero como ya es conocida, Teodora, aún sigue deleitando a los visitantes, con cocos, golosinas, cervezas. Ahora, a pesar D. los problemas que tiene en la rodilla, ella quiere dar un paso más, pues está planeando abrir una tienda más granD. y acogedora. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y como socia nueva D. su banco comunal, está segura que encontrará el éxito y tranquilidad D. los demás integrantes. Por ello con el crédito solicitado, ha pensado comprar diferentes bebidas para surtir su negocio, y si el dinero le alcanza remodelará la pequeña choza turística que tienen en la catarata.
texts.en:
Teodora is 59 years old and married to 73 year-old Sebastian.  They have 9 children but only live with 2 of them: 7 year-old Mállela and 4 year-old Mayveli.  They live together in their own home which is located in Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (in the Peruvian central jungle).

Fifteen years ago, this hard-working woman had an excellent idea.  Every day she would pass by in front of the best-known waterfall in Perú, the "Tirol", and she thought that she could set up a business there selling food, drinks, sweet treats and handicrafts.  She gathered together all her strength and built a small hut decorated with local motifs.  For a long time, she maD. good profits, "I baptized the waterfall with my business but then the competition arrived" she tells us.  However, as she is already well known, Teodora still continues delighting visitors with coconut, candies and beer.  Now, in spite of the problems that she has with her knee, she would like to take one step further as she is planning to open a larger and more welcoming store.

This is Teodora's fourth loan with MFP and, as a new member of her community bank, she is certain that she will find both success and peace amongst the other members of the bank.  She is requesting this loan to buy different drinks with which to stock her business and, if the money reaches far enough, she will re-model her small tourist hut that she has by the waterfall.

loans.use: To buy drinks to stock her business and to re-model her hut

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Véronique est mariée à Théophile et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Véronique vit ensemble avec sa famille depuis sept ans à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Véronique n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs cinq ans que Véronique mène comme activité la vente de sachets et de tissus de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet d'aider son mari dans les dépenses du ménage. Véronique achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Véronique sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé afin d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d'année.
texts.en: Born in 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Véronique is married to Théophile and is the mother of three, all of whom attend school. Véronique has been living with her family in Ekpè for seven years, in the Sèmè-Podji village. The couple share the family’s living expenses. Véronique has never attended school. Véronique has been selling bags and fabric door to door for about five years, a business which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. Véronique buys her products at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. This is the second time Véronique is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to increase her business and to better satisfy the needs of her clientele, especially in these holiday periods at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy bags and fabric

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José Miguel,  es un señor entusiasta muy dedicado a sus labores, tiene 52 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután vive con su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, sembrando maíz y hortalizas, estos cultivos los comercializa y también sirve para consumo familiar.
Él está en proceso de sembrar maíz y hortalizas por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales y realzar una buena siembra, comprando abono y fertilizantes que es lo necesario para llevar a cabo esta actividad.
Don José espera tener una buena producción y comercializarla a buen precio, además de cancelar oportunamente este préstamo.
texts.en:
José Miguel is an enthusiastic man who is very committed to his work.  He is 52 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department, with his wife and children.  He works in agriculture, growing corn and vegetables.  He sells his crops and also uses some for his family's own consumption.

José Miguel is in the process of sowing corn and vegetables and is requesting a loan to buy the materials he needs to ensure a good sowing season.  He would like to buy manure and fertilizers which is what he needs to carry out this activity.  José hopes to grow his crops well and sell them for a good price.  He also hopes to pay off this loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to sow his corn and vegetables

loans.name: Sandra Jaqueline

texts.es:
Sandra de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tuvo que mantener a su hija sola porque su esposo la abandono. Comenzó a trabajar en un gabinete de belleza para poder mantener a su hija. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio trabaja en la actualidad en un local alquilado que lo ha dirigido para vender desayunos porque es más rentable que el gabinete de belleza. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 14h00pm vendiendo en los desayunos tostadas con huevos y jugo natural o con leches, café. Aunque trabaja con dedicación y con una ayudante en ocasiones se enferma y eso complica atender a su negocio. 

Sigue con sus metas y proyectos por eso quiere continuar con su negocio de desayunos por lo que con el préstamo quiere comprar frutas, pan, queso para sus desayunos. En el futuro quiere agrandar el negocio y seguir trabajando para asegurar el futuro de su hija.
texts.en:
Sandra is 44 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who had to support her daughter alone because her husband left her.  She started working in a beauty salon so that she could support her daughter.

Sandra lives in an urban area called Suburbio.  She currently works in rented premises where she sells breakfasts because it is more profitable than the beauty salon.  She currently works from 7.00am to 2.00pm selling breakfasts: eggs and toast with natural juice, milk or coffee.  Although she works with commitment and has the help of an assistant, sometimes she becomes sick and this complicates looking after her business.

Sandra continues with her goals and projects and would like to continue with her breakfast business.  She would like to use her loan to buy fruit, bread and cheese for her breakfasts.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and continue working to guarantee her daughter's future.

loans.use: To buy fruit, bread and cheese

loans.name: Josefina Abigail

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina Abigail; ella tiene 59 años de edad y es soltera  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos naturales, ella tiene una tienda en el centro comercial el molino que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante asus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos naturales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos naturales al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina Abigail belongs to the "COMUZONE I" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Josefina Abigail is 59 years old.  She is single and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling natural products.  She has a store in the El Molino shopping mall where she serves from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  Through this business she gets her children ahead in life.

Josefina Abigail would like to expand her business selling natural products.  She is requesting this loan to buy natural products wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy natural products wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more secondhand cloths for resale

loans.name: Aunt

texts.en:
Aunt A. D. sells gari (crispy cassava), beans, eggs, corn dough and other food items at Takoradi.  Aunt has received a high school education.  She is divorced and has one child. 

She has been in this trade for two years. She sees to the well-being of her household. The loan will help her expand her business. She will use the loan to buy more food stuffs for sale. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es:
Don Atilio, es un señor dinámico, administra su tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, tiene 64 años de edad, vive con su esposa y residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, el negocio lo tienen desde hace 10 años y lo administran juntos invirtiendo en productos que son demandados por los clientes.
Don Atilio desea comprar productos para la tienda y solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión, comprara arroz, aceite, mayonesa, pan de barra, pollo, pastas y condimentos, con esta ayudara surtirá el negocio y mejorara su servicio a la clientela que a  diario le solicitan productos para preparar alimentos.
Él quiere cancelar este préstamo puntualmente, así como también realizar una buena inversión al negocio que logre estabilizar los ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de él  y su esposa.
texts.en:
Atilio is a dynamic gentleman.  He runs a store where he sells essentials.  He is 64 years old and lives with his wife in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  He and his wife have had their business for 10 years and they run it together, investing in products that their customers are asking for.

Atilio would like to buy products for his store and he is requesting a loan so that he can make this investment.  He will buy rice, oil, mayonnaise, baguettes, chicken, pasta and condiments.  This will help him to stock his business and improve his service to his customers who visit his store every day requesting products to prepare their meals with.

Atilio would like to pay back his loan on time and also make a good investment in his business that will enable him to stabilize his income and improve  his wife's quality of life as well as his own.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, mayonnaise, baguettes, chicken, pasta and condiments

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta, de 43 años, convive con Gabino, de 44 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero cuida de dos de ellas, Felicita, de 24 y María, de 6 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). Hace 20 años que se dedicó a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de frutos como piña, y cítricos. Todas las mañanas junto a su esposo Gabino trabajan arduamente para poder sacar adelante sus cultivos; los que cada fin de semana venden en el depósito de frutas que se ubica en la ciudad, donde los intermediarios constantemente llevan a diferentes lugares del Perú. Pero como Antonia tiene que mandar constantemente dinero a la capital, donde su hija Felicita, estudia Contabilidad en una universidad reconocida; abrió hace tan solo 2 años una tienda de comestibles donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los habitantes de su localidad, es así que ella quiere seguir trabajando arduamente para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, y según menciona está contenta, con el trabajo que cada mes hace con los integrantes de su banco comunal, donde aprender a salir adelante. Con el crédito solicitado, ha pensado surtir su negocio de comestibles, y si el dinero le alcanza podrá invertir en la compra de algunos sacos de abono orgánico que le falta para su cultivo.
texts.en:
Antonieta is 43 years old.  She lives with her partner, 44 year-old Gabino.  They have three children but currently only look after two of them: 24 year-old Felicita and 6 year-old María.  They live together in their own home which is located in Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Antonieta has been working in agriculture for 20 years.  Her main crops are fruit such as pineapples and citrus fruits.  Every morning she works hard, together with her husband Gabino, to grow their crops.  Every weekend they sell their produce in the fruit wholesalers in the city from where middlemen constantly transport the fruit to different places in Peru.  However, as Antonia has to constantly send money to the capital city, where her daughter Felicita is studying accountancy at a well-known University, 2 years ago she also opened a grocery store where she sells essentials to the residents of her town.  She would like to continue working hard so that she can get her children ahead in life.

This is Antonieta's ninth loan with MFP and she says that she is happy with the work that she does with the other members of her community bank  every month, where she learns to get ahead.  Antonieta plans to use this loan to stock her grocery store business and, if the money reaches far enough, she will invest in buying some sacks of organic fertilizer that she needs for her crops.

loans.use: To buy products to stock her store and to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Naranjitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “Naranjitas” está iniciando su ciclo número dos en el Centro Focal de GERMAN BUSCH. Cuenta con nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón.  Don Salustio es el único varón de la B.C. Naranjitas.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Lidia, por la tesorera, la señora Angélica y como secretaria de actas María.  Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio, producción  y servicio, como ser: venta de pan, comerciante de ropa, venta de sombreros, mantas, comerciante en vinagre, chapista, venta de juego de aretes, tejido de mantas, venta de tunta (papa deshidratada) 
La señora  Lidia presidenta de la BC “Naranjitas”, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
Hace mas de diez años, unas amigas le enseñaron a vender “tunta” y viendo que era un negocio que le brindaba ganancias decidió mantenerlo, actualmente ella compra “tunta” de la ciudad de El Alto, de una zona comercial llamada La Ceja y lleva a vender a la ciudad de Oruro. 
La señora Lidia indica que utilizará su crédito para comprar tunta,  debido a que es un producto muy requerido, debido a que se trata de un ingrediente importante en los platos tradiciones de fiesta como la sajta de pollo.
Cuando le consultan sobre  qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
Las señoras de la Banca Comunal “Naranjitas” se encontraban entusiasmadas por que tenían planificado compartir un plato de comida, este día de reunión, se ubicaron en la foto siete socias y la señora que cocinó el  plato (señora de chompa anaranjada y chaleco a cuadros, en la fila de atrás, de pie).  (La foto del señor Salustio se encuentra en esquina superior derecha)
texts.en:
The “Naranjitas” community bank is starting its second loan cycle as part of the GERMAN BUSCH regional office.  The group has nine members: eight women and one man.  Salustio is the only man.  The group's board is made up of the president, Lidia; the treasurer, Angélica and the secretary, María.  The ladies' businesses are related to commerce, production and services.  They include: bread sales, clothes sales, hat sales, blanket sales, vinegar sales, panel beater, hoop game sales, blanket weaving and 'tunta' sales (tunta is dried potato).

Lídia is the president of the community bank.  She is married and has four children.

More than ten years ago, some friends taught Lídia to sell 'tunta' and, seeing that it was a business that made good profits, she decided to keep it going.  She currently buys 'tunta' in the city of El Alto, in a business area called 'La Ceja', and she takes it to the city of Oruro to sell.

Lídia says that she will use her loan to buy more 'tunta' since it is a product that is very much in demand as it is an important ingredient in traditional festive meals such as 'saita de pollo'.

When we asked her what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the loans.

The ladies of the Naranjitas community bank are happy in this picture because they are planning to share a meal on the day of this meeting.  There are seven bank members in this photo and also the lady who cooked the meal (the lady in the orange sweater and checked waistcoat in the back row, standing up).  Salustio's photo appears in the upper right-hand corner.

loans.use: To buy 'tunta' (dried potato)

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Y. is a seamstress. She also sells slippers at Takoradi. She received vocational taining in school. She is married and has two children. She helps her husband with school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to expand her sewing business. She hopes the added income will also help boost her slipper business.

loans.use: To expand her sewing business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. K. is thirty three years old and married with two children aged four and one and half. He hopes to give them a good education to the university level. His business is located at Kitengela town, next to a slaughterhouse. He owns a furniture workshop and makes such items as beds, sofas, tables, coffee tables, armchairs, wardrobes and wall units. He sells to the local people. He has been in this business for nine years. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is locked-up capital as a result of people ordering items they never pick up. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well and is using his loan of Kes 70,000 to buy a wood machine to grow his business. 

David hopes to own a big furniture shop one day with ready-made and ready-to-sell furniture. He describes himself as strict and committed to his work.

loans.use: to buy a wood machine

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. M. is married with five adult children. Her business is located at the busy Shiro market in Kakamega — a region in Kenya that produces sugar cane, known as the sugar belt region. She sells milk to the local restaurants and residents in the Shiro area. 

Joyce also owns a hardware store where she sells such items as iron sheets, cement, and nails. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She says that her business is profitable and her only major challenge is competition from other people in the area doing the same kind of business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well and is using her loan of Kes 70,000 to grow her milk business and increase her stock of hardware items. In the future, she hopes to open another hardware store since that business is more profitable. She also sees herself buying a car and a house. Joyce describes herself as hardworking, polite, and generous.

loans.use: Milk and items for her hardware store e.g. iron sheets, cement and nails

loans.name: H. Félicienne

texts.fr: Née en 1962, H. Félicienne habite Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis quarante cinq ans. Félicienne est mariée à un agent de sécurité nommé Jean-Paul et est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, deux ne sont plus à la charge du couple. Félicienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité, Félicienne vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges du ménage. Félicienne mène en effet comme activité la vente de bouillie (faite de maïs ou de mil, accompagné de sucre). Parallèlement à cette activité, Félicienne vend également de l'igname à son domicile. Félicienne exerce cette activité depuis vingt trois ans et s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Félicienne  sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer ses activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Born in 1962, H. Félicienne has lived in Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, for forty five years.  Félicienne is married to a security agent named John Paul and is the mother of five children, who all attend school.  Among the children, two are no longer dependant on the couple.  Félicienne lives with her children and husband.  Thanks to the income that she obtains from her business, Félicienne can help her husband with the expenses of the household.  Félicienne has as her occupation the sale of bouillie (made from corn or millet flour, with sugar).  Along with this activity, Félicienne also sells yams from her residence.  Félicienne has performed this activity for twenty three years and supplies her business in Dantokpa, international market of Benign.  This is the first time that Félicienne has requested a loan from ALIDé, which she needs to reinforce her activities and better respond to the requests of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy corn, millet, sugar and yams

loans.name: Manuel Isaac

texts.es:
Manuel, tiene 27 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, posee una farmacia de la que recibe las ganancias para los gastos  del hogar, él vive con su esposa  y su hija, este negocio primeramente fue administrado por su abuela y en los últimos años se la heredo para que fuera quien le diera seguimiento al negocio.
Por el compromiso de dar continuidad a la farmacia Manuel solicita un préstamo para realizarle inversiones en medicamentos a dicho negocio, con esta ayuda fortalecerá la farmacia y será mejor el servicio y la atención que brindara a los clientes.
Su objetivo es cumplir con el mantenimiento y buen servicio de la farmacia contando con clientes quienes desde hace mucho le conocen, también con el fortalecimiento del inventario de medicamentos busca generar más beneficios para la familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 27 years old.  He lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  He owns a pharmacy from which he makes profits to cover his household expenses.

Manuel lives with his wife and daughter.  This business used to be run by his grandmother and he recently inherited it so that he could keep it running.

In order to keep his pharmacy running, Manuel is requesting a loan so that he can make some investments in buying medicine for his business.  This will help to strengthen the pharmacy and help him to provide a better service to his customers.

Manuel's goal is to keep the pharmacy running and to keep providing a good service to the customers who he has known for a long time.  By strengthening his inventory of medicines, he is looking to make more profits for his family.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Donia

texts.es: Está bella niña, es Samira, de 7 años de edad, es la razón de vivir de Donia, de 39 años, que junto a su esposo Francisco, de 40 años, y sus 3 hijos: Abel, de 21, Yerry, de 16 y Paúl, de 13 años de edad; viven en unión familiar en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). Donia, hace 12 años, conocedora de su buena sazón en la cocina, acondicionó un pequeño espacio en su casa, donde todos los días, vende comida típica y local, entre sus platos preferidos tiene yuca rellena, patasca, y diferentes potajes a base de pescados de río. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es la hora en que se llena su local, no solo con personas oriundas del lugar, también con turistas, los que cada año la visitan. Ella se siente realizada y con muchas ganas de progresar; por ello está pensando invertir sus fuerzas y ahorros en la apertura de una tienda de comestibles; con el que piensa abastecer a sus pobladores de productos de primera necesidad. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y conocedora del trabajo esforzado y sacrificado de las integrantes de su banco comunal, se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe. Con el crédito que recibe, ha pensado invertir en el negocio de compra y venta de queso, el cual repartirá entre los pobladores de su localidad; que conocedores del proyecto de Donia, ya le hicieron muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
This beautiful little girl is Samira, 7.  She is Donia’s reason for living.  Donia, 39, together with her husband Francisco, 40, and their three children: Abel, 21, Yerry, 16 and Paúl, 13, live together as a family in Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (Peruvian central jungle).

Thanks to her tasty food preparation, Donia twelve years ago set up a small space in her house as an eatery.  She sells typical local dishes daily.  Among the favorite dishes are: stuffed manioc, patasca (thick stew made by boiling a whole pig, sheep or beef head) and various stews based on river fish.  What she most enjoys is the moment her eatery fills up not only with locals but with tourists too who come by each year to visit.

She feels very fulfilled and wanting to progress.  Because of this she is planning to invest her efforts and savings into the opening of a grocery store that she plans to use to supply residents with basic need items.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and, fully aware of the sacrifice and hard work of the members of her communal bank, she feels grateful for the support she’s received.

She will use the loan she gets to invest in the purchase and sale of cheese which she will distribute among the residents in her area who, knowing of Donia’s project, already have placed several orders.

loans.use: To buy cheese to go into foodstuffs sales.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, blusas, casacas y polos, ella vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al público en general, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina, 40, is a member of the “COMUZONE I” communal bank located in Cusco district.  It’s part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is single and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with clothing sales.  She sells pants, blouses, jackets and polo-type shirts taking them to sell at various institutions and to the general public.  She’d like to expand the business and is asking for the loan to buy clothes at wholesale.

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Aristides

texts.es:
José, reside en Jucuapa, departamento de Usulután, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 18, 14 y 10 años de edad, posee un negocio con pollos de engorde, lo inicio su padre y luego le cedió a José para que lo administrara, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde hace 12 años.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pollos y concentrado para la alimentación, ya que desea aumentar el número  en su granja para ofrecer a los clientes de la zona, este crédito le ayudara incrementando la granja para la comercialización, además le ayudara a generar mejores ganancias para el hogar.
Sus aspiraciones son instalar una nueva granja de pollos y ayudar a sus hijos para que continúen sus estudios.
texts.en:
José, 39, lives in Jucuapa, Usulután department with his wife and three children who are 18, 14 and 10 years of age.  He has a poultry raising business that his father started and then passed on to José to run.  He has worked Monday through Sunday for the last 12 years.

He is asking for a loan now to buy chicks and concentrated feed because he wants to increase his flock size to have more to offer his area customers. The loan will make it possible for him to increase production for sale.  He also wants to generate higher profits for his household.

His hopes are to set up a new poultry ranch and help his children to continue with their studies.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen de 62 años, empezó con el negocio de la tienda hace años atrás porque la situación económica de su hogar no estaba estable ya que su esposo no tenía suficientes ingresos. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio Carmen tuvo la idea de construir un pequeño local en la parte delantera de su casa para una tienda. En la actualidad tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Se levanta a las 06h00am ha preparar la tienda para que esté lista para sus cliente y trabaja vendiendo platanos, arroz, legumbres entre otros hasta las 22h00pm. 

Quiere continuar con su tienda porque le ha ayudado para solventar los gastos de su casa con ayuda de su esposo. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, legumbres, confites para su tienda. En el futuro quiere seguir con fuerzas para continuar trabajando en su tienda si Dios lo permite.
texts.en:
Carmen, 62, started her grocery store years ago because the economic situation of her household wasn’t stable because her husband did not have sufficient income.

Living in an urban area called Suburbio, Carmen got the idea to build a small store in the front of her house.  She currently has a small store in the front of her house.  She rises daily at 6am to prepare the store so that it will be ready to receive customers.  She works selling bananas, rice and legumes, among others, until 10pm

She wants to stay in business with the store because it has helped her meet household expenses with her husband’s help.  She wants to use the loan to buy rice, legumes and sweets for the store.  In the future, God willing, she wants to continue to have the strength to continue working in her store.

loans.use: For rice and legumes.

loans.name: Clodine

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Clodine est mariée à Florent et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Clodine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis neuf ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Clodine n'a pas été à l'école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Clodine vend de la bouillie (faite à base de maïs et du sucre) et du "Akpan" (fait à base de mil) de façon ambulante. Clodine se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Clodine exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. En vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, Clodine sollicite une fois encore l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born in 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Clodine is married to Florent and is the mother of four, all of whom attend school. Clodine has been living with her family in Ekpè for about nine years, in the Sèmè-Podji village. The couple share the family’s expenses. Clodine has never attended school. To take care of the needs of her children, Clodine sells porridge (made of corn and sugar) and "Akpan" (made from millet) door to door. Clodine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Clodine has been doing this for five years and has already gotten a loan from ALIDé, which was repaid. In order to grow her business, Clodine is once more seeking financial support from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy corn, millet, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy iron, nails and soldering tips.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado es de Capiata en fecha 21deoctubre de 2009, gracias a que la actual Directora Finanzas la  Sra. Teodora F., quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  ,contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la  Fundación Paraguaya.
La presidenta del grupo es la señora Maria quien se dedica a la venta comestibles como empanadas, milanesas, panchos, hamburguesas y otros.
Ella todos los días se empeña con mucho esmero para preparar los comestibles para vender y de esta forma logra ayudar bastante bien a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne y aceite, ingredientes esenciales de sus comestibles y actualmente presentan un precio bastante alto en nuestro medio.
texts.en: Las Emprendedoras [Entrepreneurial Women] is the name of the excellent group of women from Capiata, formed on October 21, 2009, thanks to the efforts of the current Director of Finances, Mrs. Teodora F., who sells fruits and vegetables. At a weekly meeting of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendadoras [Committee of Women Entrepreneurs] that was being held in her area, Mrs. F. consulted with the adviser to find out what kind of work  they did. Once she was advised about the Program, she managed to pull together 21 women who are already in their 6th loan cycle happily working together in solidarity within the program. All of them do activities to earn money, and they help each other to reach common goals within the group and in Fundación Paraguaya. The president of the group is Maria, who sells prepared foods such as empanadas, breaded meat cutlets, hot dogs, hamburgers and more. Every day she is determined to take great care in preparing the foods to sell, and in this way to be a great help to her family. She requests the loan for the purchase of meat and oil, essential ingredients for her foods, and which these days are very expensive in our area.

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla N. is 53 years old. She is single and has four children aged between twenty one years old and nine years old. Her business is located at a busy market in Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is known as the sugar belt region. She sells cereals, which include ground nuts, peas, rice, wheat and others. She has been in this business for 20 years now and has one employee. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 10,000  KES to buy more cereals to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. In future, she hopes to open a retail shop and also purchase land. She describes herself as visionary, determined, loving and caring.

loans.use: Maize and Wheat

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela, de 53 años, está casada con Juan, de 49 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Bruno, de 28, Rafael, de 26 y Maribel, de 24 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). La principal actividad económica de está sacrificada mujer, es la agricultura, la siembra de cítricos en sus diferentes variedades es su principal actividad, ya tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a ello. En todo este tiempo puedo invertir bien sus ganancias; como la compra de una moto taxi (moto con asientos, que sirve para trasportar personas), menciona, y ahora es la actividad a la que se dedica, al trasporte público de la ciudad.
