Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta por el compañerismo que existe entre todas las socias,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más sabanas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Janneth Rodrígez is a member of the “Nueva Vida” [New Life] communal bank. She lives in the Virgen de Bronce neighborhood in the city of Cuenca. This city is well known for the beauty of its architecture, beautiful views, cuisine that captivates both locals and foreigners, and its friendly and welcoming people.

Janneth is 31 years old. She is married and has 3 children who are 12, 11, and 4 years old. Her first daughter is in high school, and her second daughter is in grade school. Her husband is a professional driver and he drives a taxi. They don’t have their own house, which is why they rent. 

Janneth works as a cashier in a well-known shopping center. She has been at this job for one year and her schedule is variable. She works from Sunday to Sunday. In her free time she sells sheets, which she has been doing for four years. 

This is the fourth loan she has taken with the communal bank. She likes it because of the friendships between the members. She will use the loan to buy more sheets. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy sheets.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 60 años, de estado civil casada tiene 06 hijos  independientes, realizo estudios de educación primaria.

Trabaja hace  más de 01 años con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 dinero, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados como ovejas y vacas.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando un toro.  Ella trabaja junto con su esposo.

Sueña tener más capital para terminar de arreglar su casa y mejorar su condición de vida.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y estar alegres con las socias.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Huancheñas” in the District and Province of Huancané, Department of Puno. She is 60 years old, married, and has six children who are independent. Yolanda has an elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for more than a year. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and was invested in her business of buying and selling livestock, such as sheep and cows.

Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 1500 PEN to invest in the purchase of a bull. She and her husband work together. Her dream is to have more capital so that she can finish repairing her home and improve her living conditions. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and being happy with the other members.

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Martha Petrona

texts.es: Martha Petrona se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos. Pues siempre le ha gustado ser una joven muy emprendedora y trabajadora.  Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. Ella tiene a su hija de 7 años que depende de ella, que con su esfuerzo ha logrado obtener este medio de vida que las mantiene. Todos los días se tiene que levantar temprano para realizar su trabajo y proporcionar el alimento diario.
texts.en:
Martha Petrona sells dairy products. She has always enjoyed being an enterprising and hardworking young woman. This is not the first time she has received financing for her business.

Martha has a seven year old daughter who is dependent on her. Through her efforts she is able to make a living so that she can support herself. Every day she wakes up early so that she can complete her work and provide for her daily needs.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jennifer Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Jennifer J. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Vida, vive por el sector de la Virgen de Bronce en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su arquitectura, sus paisajes, su gastronomía que cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños y su gente es muy cálida y amable.

Nuestra socia es muy joven tiene 20 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, el primero de 3 años de edad y su segundo hijo de apenas un mes de nacido. Su esposo es chofer profesión y labora conduciendo un taxi, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros.

Doña Jennifer se dedica a la venta de frutas, esta actividad la realiza hace 6 años, tienen un local propio y labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá a formar parte del banco,  el dinero de su crédito lo va invertir en la compra de más frutas para su local. Su meta es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jennifer J. is a member of the Nueva Vida (New Life) communal bank.  She lives around the Virgen de Bronce sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its architecture, its scenery, its gastronomy that captivates the palates of locals and foreigners alike and by the warmth and kindness of its people.

She is a young 20 year old, married, mother of two children.  The oldest is 3 years old and the youngest is barely a month old.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  They do not have a house of their own; they live in her in-laws’ house.

Jennifer has been a fruit merchant for six years.  She has her own stand and works from Sunday to Sunday from 8am to 8pm.

This is her 3rd loan with the communal bank; her mother invited her to join.  She will use the money from the loan to buy more fruit for her stand.  Her goal is to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Señora. María S. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Vida, vive por el sector de la Virgen de Bronce en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su arquitectura, sus paisajes, su gastronomía que cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños y su gente es muy calida y amable.

Doña María tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 16, 13 años de edad, sus dos hijos  estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es  Técnico Electrónico y brinda servicios técnicos de vehículos en su propio local, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. María trabaja en el local junto con su esposo, vende todo tipo de audio para vehículos (radios, parlantes), esta actividad la realiza hace 12 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.

Este es el cuarto crédito que realiza y fue invitada por su suegra a formar parte del banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería (radios). Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
María S. is a member of the “Nueva Vida” (New Life) communal bank.  She lives in the “La Virgen de Bronze” sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its architecture, its landscapes, and its food that captures the pallets of locals and guests.  Its residents are warm and friendly.

María is 45 years old.  She’s married and has two children, ages 16 and 13, who attend the local school.  Her husband works as an electronics technician and also does auto electrical repairs from his own shop.  They live in a rented home.

María works in the shop with her husband and sells all sorts of sound equipment for cars (radios, speakers).  She’s been doing this for 12 years and works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM.

This will be her fourth loan.  She had been invited into the communal bank by her mother in law.  She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise (radios).  Her goal is to buy a house of their own.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.en:
Vilma A. is from the town of Puntod, Lopez Jaena. Vilma is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Vilma is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma harvests and sells lake-caught fish in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be Vilma's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase four heads of sheep

loans.name: Frese

texts.en:
Frese B. is from the village of Butuay,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Frese is single. To make a living, Frese owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting flowers for sale. Frese has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Frese joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Frese is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Frese from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pigs & llamas

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna V. is from the village of Mialem,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Myrna is married and has 5 school-age children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising goats for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her capital in order to purchase two cows

loans.name: Dalmacia

texts.en: Dalmacia S. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 56 years old. Dalmacia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Dalmacia raises pigs for sale. Dalmacia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,880 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Dalmacia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dalmacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Dalmacia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Dalmacia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sheep, pigs, and a donkey

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en:
Baatar M. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic home dwelling called a ger. His oldest daughter attends a local primary school, while the youngest daughter is in kindergarten. 

Baatar makes a variety of wooden items and furniture in his own work shop next to his home, in his yard. His wife helps him with the business by selling his products at the local markets. He started his business in 1995 after graduating from vocational training center as a carpenter in 1992.  In addition, he operates a construction business during summer months to supplement his earnings. 

In the 15 years of owning his business, Baatar has gained experience and knowledge in making quality furniture products and his earnings have enabled him to provide for his family. For the future, he plans to establish a small construction group, partnering with other construction workers. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more wood and furniture-making supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy more wood and furniture-making supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Ramos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven empresario de 24 años de edad, reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Ferreñafe, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con dos mototaxis (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte de carga y pasajeros), usualmente se encarga de manejar una mientras que alquila la otra. El suele brindar su servicio en su localidad y en los centros poblados que conforman la periferia del distrito. La actividad le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Carlos desea brindar mantenimiento a sus mototaxis, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a su sistema mecánico, asimismo planea adquirir algunos repuestos para equiparlas y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young entrepreneur of 24 years. He resides with his parents in the Ferrenafe district, an area of regular commercial activity that is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has two mototaxis (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcucle that has a cabin attached so he can transport cargo and passengers). Usually, he is in charge of driving one while he rents out the other. He usually provides his service in his area and in the populated centers that are on the periphery of the district. The activity allows him to pay his personal bills and support his family with daily economic support.

Carlos wishes to provide maintenance for his mototaxis. For this, he has seen fit to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 2,000 new "soles" which will allow him to provide maintenance to the mechanical system. Additionally, he plans to acquire some spare parts to equip them and provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: Expenses for repairing and maintaining his mototaxi.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 62 años de edad, es soltera y reside en el distrito de Eten, una zona comercial que se caracteriza por los trabajos en junco que realizan sus pobladoras. Se encuentra ubicado a más de veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de diez años a la comercialización de verduras en un puesto ubicado en el interior del mercado de la localidad en donde reside. Ella adquiere su mercadería en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la región) y la ofrece brindando siempre un buen trato a sus clientes. El negocio le brinda los ingresos necesarios para subsistir y salir adelante.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus cientes, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 62 years old, single and resides in the district of Eten, a commercial area known for the reed work that its residents make. It is located more than 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 10 years, she has been dedicated to selling produce from a stall located in the interior of the market of the area where she lives. She acquires her merchandise in the Moshoqueque market (the wholesale market in the region) and she always offers a good deal to her customers. The business provides her with the necessary income to subsist and get ahead.

Maria wishes to expand her business acquiring more merchandise to satisfy the demand of her customers. For this she has seen the necessity to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,500 new "soles" that will help her acheive her objective.

loans.use: Adquisición de más mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business by acquiring more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing goods in larger quantity

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus danzas y tradiciones de raices afroperuanas, se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la ganadería. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo. Ellos crían vacas para extraer la leche que producen y venderla diariamente a los vecinos de la zona. Los animales son criados al aire libre, en unos terrenos de cultivo cercanos a su vivienda. Adicionalmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega con la cual complementan sus ingresos para salir adelante.

Luz María desea implementar su negocio de ganadería con la compra de un ternero el cual planea engordar para luego vender su carne. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Luz es una mujer entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad solicitó en crédito para implementar su bodega. Ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con los prestamistas que colaboraron con ella a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Luz María is 30 years old, is married and has a son. She lives alongside her family in a rural area in the district of Zaña, a district known on a regional level for its dances and traditions of Afro-Peruvian roots. It is located forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been dedicated for six years to cattle. She does this work alongside her husband. They raise cattle for the milk they produce and sell it daily to neighbors in the area. The animals are raised in the open air, on a piece of land near their house. Additionally, they have a small shop through which they complement their income in order to get ahead.

Luz María wishes to expand her cattle business with the purchase of a calf, which she plans to fatten so she can then sell its meat. To achieve this objective, she has seen fit to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,000 new "soles" that will allow her to achieve her objective.

Luz is a woman dedicated to her family and work. She has already had a loan financed by Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and its product Capital Semilla. In that opportunity, she requested a loan to start her shop. She is thankful for the lenders who collaborated with her through Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase a calf.

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, vive en el sector Santiago de Miraflores en el distrito de Zaña, una zona conocida por sus danzas típicas de influencia afro – peruana, queda ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de dos años se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en un ambiente de su domicilio. Este negocio nació de la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante, ya que de el depende el sustento de su familia. Ella trata de brindar productos de calidad y ofrecer un buen trato a sus clientes. Su negocio goza de buena acogida y ello la pone orgullosa y contenta.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos por ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Asunciona ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad ha podido realizar mejoras en su vivienda, por lo que se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través de Kiva. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de calidad que les aseguren un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Asunciona is 39 years old and lives in the Santiago de Miraflores sector of the district of Zaña, an area known for its traditional Afro-Peruvian dancing. It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She is separated from her husband and is raising her four children. 

For more than two years, she has been selling basic household goods and groceries from a small store set up in her house. Asunciona started her business to support her children since she is the sole provider for the family. She tries to stock high-quality products and offer good customer service. Her business enjoys a good reputation among customers and Asunciona is proud and happy to have the recognition.

Asunciona hopes to expand her business by stocking merchandise high in demand by her customers. This will increase her sales income. Asunciona is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her objective. She has already had a loan financed by Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa's Capital Semilla ('seed capital') loan product. Through that opportunity, she was able to make improvements to her home and she is very grateful to the people who supported her through Kiva. Asunciona's greatest dream is to provide her children with a better quality of life and a good education to guarantee them a successful future.

loans.use: To expand business with the purchase of products in high demand by customers.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia D. Huancané y departamento D. Puno, tiene 62 años, D. estado civil casada, tiene 01 hio dependientes, realizó estudios D. educación primaria.

Trabaja más D. 01 años con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue D.  S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. granos D. la región, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. ganados.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo crédito D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar  tres unidades D. ovejas, la señora también teje frazadas.

Su sueño es tener un buen ganado para su negocio

Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque intercambian palabras.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the Las Huancheñas communal bank from the Huancané district, located in the province of Huancané and in the department of Puno. She is 62 years old, married, and has one child who is her dependent. She completed elementary school.

She has worked for more than a year with Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her first loan was for 400 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she invested in her business selling regional grains. She currently works selling cattle.

She is now requesting a new loan for 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), with which she will invest in the purchase of three sheep. Manuela also knits blankets.

Her dream is to have good cattle for her business.

What she likes about her communal bank are the meetings because they exchange conversation.

loans.use: To purchase three sheep

loans.name: Fredesbinda

texts.es:
Fredesbinda es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Zaña, una zona conocida por sus danzas típicas de influencia afro – peruana, queda ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de siete años a la crianza y venta de ovejas. Ella cría estos animales en algunos corrales situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, alimentándolos de pastos naturales. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. El negocio le permite agenciarse de algunos ingresos, los cuales utiliza en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Fredesbinda desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más ovejas y alimentos balanceados, con ello planea ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Fredesbinda is a 30-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Zaña district. The area is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo and is known for its traditional Afro-Peruvian-influenced dances.

She has worked raising and selling sheep for more than seven years. She raises these animals in pens located in the back part of her house and feeds them natural grasses. When they have reached a good size, she sells them to the general public and to the businessmen that visit the area where she lives. The business allows her to obtain some income, which she then uses to support her family.

Fredesbinda wants to expand her business, acquiring more sheep and balanced feed. With this, she plans to earn more money. In order to achieve her objective, she has seen it necessary to request a loan of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To expand her business by acquiring more sheep and balanced feed.

loans.name: Rosa Arminda

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su profesión es la docencia y trabaja como profesora en un centro educativo de su localidad. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo ella siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez más clientes.

Johanna desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y ampliar el stock fijo de cosméticos que tiene en su vivienda, esto le permite a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente sin tener que esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old, single, and lives with her family in the district of Tambogrande, a commercial farming zone located in Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She is a teacher and works in an educational center in her town. In addition, Rosa sells catalog beauty products and cosmetics. She has a number of regular customers who frequently buy products from her. With every order, Rosa achieves "points" from the cosmetics supplier. The more points Rosa has, the higher her income will be relative to sales. That's why she is always motivated to increase her number of customers.

Rosa hopes to have a stable source of capital to acquire more products and expand her selection of cosmetics that she stocks in her home. This will allow her customers to buy the products they need more quickly without having to wait until the end of the month, when the orders are delivered. To achieve her goal, Rosa has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire more products and expand selection of cosmetics.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años, de estado civil soltera, tiene 01 hijo que depende económicamente de ella, realizó estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja hace más de 02 años con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo invirtió en su tienda con la compra de verduras, frutas, pan y gaseosas.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1700.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar  cinco unidades de harina, azúcar, gaseosas y un ganado vacuno, en el negocio le ayuda su hermana y su papá.

Su sueño es tener una empresa de transporte vía Huancané - Mucuraya.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Las Huancheñas communal bank from the Huancané district, located in the province of Huancané and in the department of Puno. She is 50 years old, single, and has one child who is her dependent. She completed post-secondary studies.

She has worked for more than two years with Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she invested in her store by purchasing vegetables, fruits, bread and sodas.

She is now requesting a new loan for 1,700 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), with which she will invest in the purchase of five units of flour, sugar, sodas and cattle. Her sister and father help her with the business.

Her dream is to have a transportation company between Huancané and Mucuraya.

What she likes about her communal bank are the meetings.

loans.use: To purchase groceries such as flour, sugar, and soda, among other items.

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan S. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house and fenced yard in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His two children both attend a local secondary school. 

Bayarsaihan operates a women's clothing and lingerie retail business from a rented stall at a local clothing market. He sells a variety of different clothing items and underwear. His wide product selection attracts many customers. He started his women's clothing business in 2004 and has since built a stable and successful operation. He makes his purchases of clothing twice in a month in Erlian, a border city in China. Bayarsaihan says, "All I want is to pay off my house-leasing loan and I plan to start saving money for the future education of my children." 

Bayarsaihan is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import more clothing items from China to sell at his stall in the market.

loans.use: To import women's clothing items from China.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas” del distrito Huancané,  provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años, de estado civil conviviente tiene 01 hijo que depende económicamente de ella, realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

La señora recientemente se incorpora con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos, su préstamo  solicitado fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas fuera de los establecimientos, con el cual comprará víveres como arroz, fideos, papa, carne, pollo, verduras, etc., la ayuda su cuñada y su esposo trabaja en triciclo.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia para vivir cómodos y salir adelante con el negocio.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Marianela is a member of the “Las Huancheñas” communal bank in the district of Huancané, province of Huancané and department of Puno. She is 26 years old, lives with a partner, and has one dependent child. She has completed high school.

Marianela recently joined the Manuela Ramos organization. This loan is for 500 soles, and will be invested in her business selling food and drinks outside of establishments. She will buy food supplies, such as rice, beans, potatoes, meat, chicken, vegetables, etc. Her mother-in-law helps with the business and her husband sells products from a 3-wheeled cart.

Marianela dreams of having her own house to live comfortably, and to move ahead with her business. What she likes most about the communal bank is the ease of borrowing.

loans.use: Buy food supplies, such as rice, beans, potatoes, meat, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov S. is 57 years old, married, and has five children.  They live in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for well-supplied with freshwater from major rivers. She is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. S. and her husband are farmers, earning $2 each per day.  The family has to spend $30 on food,  $1 on electricity supply, and $13 on other necessary expenses every month.  Her three children are employed, earning about $1.5 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Buyan

texts.en: Buyan R. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Mongolia's Bayanhongor province. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends a local primary school. Buyan operates a clothes trading business out of two different containers in his town with the help of his wife. They began their business in 2006, selling a variety of clothing items in a rented container at the local market, with working capital of 1,500,000 MNT, and over the years they managed to establish a successful business in the local community. After years of stable operation, they have expanded their business, and their earnings have enabled them to purchase two containers which they sell their products from. Today their working capital exceeds 6,000,000 MNT. With their business earnings, they were able to not only expand their business but also greatly improve their quality of life. Also, with their business success, they have managed to buy a car for their family. For the future, they plan to build a house in their yard. Buyan is a talkative and open-minded man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more clothing as well as consumer goods to sell from his two containers.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan C., 33, is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase firewood to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. C. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, in an area known for being well-supplied with freshwater from major rivers.   

C. and her husband sell firewood, earning an income of USD 6 per day. The family has to spend USD 66 on food, USD 15 on electricity supply, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is Phan C.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to resell

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Tan S., 41, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. S. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for being well-supplied with freshwater from major rivers. 

S. produces rice wine to sell, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 3 on electricity, and USD 17 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is S.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for her husband to operate his business

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Tong C., 33, is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. C. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for being well-supplied with freshwater from major rivers. 

C. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 1.7 per day. The family has to spend USD 23 on food, USD 3 on electricity, and USD 14 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for her husband to operate his business

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam A., 57, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more vegetables to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. A. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

A. is a vegetable seller, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 124 on food, USD 3 on electricity, and USD 2 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Dorjgotov

texts.en: Dorjgotov B. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province in Mongolia. His family lives in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). His oldest daughter is a university student and the younger two children both attend a local school. His wife operates a bakery in town. She produces a variety of pastries and breads from home to supplement the family's income. She started her business in 1992 making only one kind of bread and after years of operation she has expanded her business by increasing her product line. For the future, Dorjgotov's wife plans to open her own workplace in a rented space in the centre of town. Dorjgotov operates an iron crafts and welding service. He has been engaged in this business since 1990 and has gained a lot of experience as a craftsman over the years. Dorjgotov is a hardworking man and says, "Our dream is to establish a big factory that can provide a variety of bakeries to our local market." He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrik loan in order to purchase flour for his wife's bakery business (60% of the loan) and steels/irons for his iron craft business (40% of the loan).

loans.use: To purchase flour for his wife's bakery business and steels/irons

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Enhtsetseg G. is a 34-year-old single mother who lives with her three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). All her children attend a local school. Enhtsetseg operates an imported clothing and household goods business out of three different workplaces in her town. She began her business in 2004 after working as a salesperson in her sister's stall at the local market between 2000 and 2004. Her business has stabilized over the past year and she has begun to integrate herself into the business community. For the future, she plans to expand her business by increasing her product line. Enhtsetseg is a hardworking woman and says, "I want to continue operating my business with stable operations for the next several years and work hard to provide a decent future for my children." She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrik loan in order to import more clothes and consumer goods from China to sell at a profit.

loans.use: To import more clothes and consumer goods from China

loans.name: Gantugs

texts.en: Gantugs D. is a 35-year-old single parent who lives with her two children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger (a traditional Mongolian housing tent). Her two children both attend a local secondary school. She graduated from her local town's institute as an accountant in 2000. Gantugs operates a machinery parts trading business. She started her business in 2000 with capital of 3,000,000 tugriks (MNT). Over the years, she has gained much experience in her trade and always tries to grow and improve her business. She has built a stable business and a positive reputation among her customers. Today her working capital exceeds 10,000,000 MNT. Gantugs is a very open-minded and hardworking person. For the future, she plans to have her own workplace. Her goal is to save more money for her children's future educational expenses. Gantugs is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy supplies for her machinery parts trading business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her machinery parts trading business

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en: Nuth S., 34, is requesting a loan of $600 US to repair his house. S. makes traditional baskets to sell, earning $2.50 US per day. S. is married and lives with his wife and five children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend $60 US on food, $25 US on electricity, and $2.00 on other necessary expenses every month. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung P., 50, is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase supplies to manufacture traditional musical instruments. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. P. is a housewife. P. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend $165 US on food, $3 US on electricity, and $45 US on other necessary expenses every month. This is her seventh loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy supplies to manufacture traditional musical instruments

loans.name: Moal

texts.en:
Moal S., 43, is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. 

S. is a carpenter, earning an income of $5 per day. S. is married and resides with his wife and eight children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend $50 on food, $3 on electricity supply, and $25 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run P., 31, is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her cooking business. She is a chef for weddings or other parties. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. 

P. is a cook, earning an income of $10 per day. P. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment industry. The family has to spend $50 on food, $3 on electricity supply and $25 on other necessary expenses every month.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. P. appears in the photograph with her husband, who is a tuk-tuk driver.

loans.use: To improve her cooking business

loans.name: Wilmel

texts.en:
Wilmel D. J. is from the town of Banga. She is 23 years old. Wilmel is married and has 2 children, aged 4 and 1. To make a living, Wilmel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Wilmel works hard to grow her business.

Wilmel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilmel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Wilmel is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Gereldorj

texts.en:
Gereldorj A. is 44 years old.  He lives with his wife and four daughters in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His oldest daughter is a university student and his younger three daughters all attend a local school. 

To support his family, Gereldorj operates two businesses: a machinery parts trading and car repair center, and a transportation service in his town. He owns a small car repair business located next to the main road. At first, he rented a container at the local market from where he sold a variety of machinery parts, but after a year of successful business operation, he managed to buy a plot of land inside a property fence.  From his new property, he now sells a variety of machinery parts and provides car repair service to his customers.  He was able to buy a car with his earnings, and started his transportation business in 2010 to supplement his income. 

Gereldorj hopes to expand his businesses and establish his own machinery part trading center in the future. He is requesting an 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more machinery parts from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to sell through his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts to sell

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo C. is from the village of Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 49 years old. Pablo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Pablo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Pablo has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pablo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Pablo is requesting a new loan of 22000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Pablo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

texts.en: Kim P., 50, is requesting a loan of USD 400 to repair her house. P. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 4 per day. P. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment industry. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 23 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.name: Yoy

texts.en:
Yoy C., 28, is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a new motorbike to improve his business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. C. is married and resides with his wife and child in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment industry. 

C. is a meatball seller, earning an income of USD 15 per day. The family has to spend USD 60 on food, USD 7 on electricity supply, and USD 17 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy motorbike to improve business

loans.name: Lhagva

texts.en:
Lhagva D. is 47 years old.  She lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own house on their fenced property. Her oldest daughter attends university and her youngest daughter attends a local high school. Her middle son works and lives as a herder in the countryside raising livestock.  Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Lhagva operates a dairy retail business in her town. She began the business in 1998 with a working capital of 50,000 MNT. After many years of successful operation, her working capital now exceeds 1,400,000 MNT. For the future, she hopes to expand her business by operating multiple businesses with her husband. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products for resale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel P. is from the village of Santa Isabel. She is 44 years old. Isabel is widowed and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Isabel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Isabel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Isabel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Isabel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya N. is 44 years old.  She lives with her husband and five children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, on their own fenced property. Her oldest two children both attend university and her middle child is currently attending a local high school. Her daughter works as a salesperson, with a monthly salary of 90,000 MNT.  Her husband works as a load carrier at the local market, with a monthly salary of 150,000 MNT. 

Narantuya operates a trading business in her town, selling underwear and socks as well as cellphones. She started her own business in 1999 by purchasing ice creams at wholesale price and reselling as a retailer. After finding success and achieving stable business operations, she expanded her product line to include cell phone sales and phone call services. For the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase her product line. 

Narantuya is a talkative and open-minded person. She plans to continue operating her business with stable operation.  She is requesting a loan of  1,000,000 MNT to import more underwear and socks from Erlian, a border city to China, for her trade business.

loans.use: To import underwear and socks for resale

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You B., 39, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase fertilizer to improve his farming business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. B. is married and resides with his wife and three children in Bonteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, an area known for its commerce with Thailand. 

B. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day. The family must spend USD 44 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is B.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve farm

loans.name: Phoin

texts.en:
Phoin S., 29, is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase fabric and a new sewing machine. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. S. is married and resides with his wife and child in Bonteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, an area known for its commerce with Thailand. 

S. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 5 per day. The family must spend USD 50 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 31 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg T. is 37 years old.  She lives with her husband and three daughters in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest daughter attends a local secondary school and her youngest two daughters are in kindergarten.  Her husband operates a coal trading business in town.  

Oyunchimeg currently operates a food cafe called "Hatan Buuz"  (meaning "Queen Dumpling").  She started in business in 2000 by operating a second-hand shoes trading business in a rented stall at the local market. In 2007, she moved to Darhan city where she opened a cafe in a rented space. In 2008, she moved back to her current city and purchased the premise where now runs her cafe. 

In the future, she hopes to expand by adding more branches to her cafe business. She is a hardworking and modest. For the future, she is planning to open a big restaurant. She is requesting a loan for  1,500,000 MNT to improve the tools and equipment for her cafe, and to purchase more coal and firewood to sell.

loans.use: To improve tools and equipment for cafe

loans.name: Alvin Xandrell

texts.en:
Alvin Xandrell C. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 19 years old. Alvin Xandrell is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Alvin Xandrell owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Alvin Xandrell has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP when he sells one of his raised animals.

In 2009, Alvin Xandrell joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alvin Xandrell has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell. Alvin Xandrell is requesting a new loan of 34000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alvin Xandrell from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of  his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros S., 45, is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for family use. S. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 7 per day. S. is married and resides with his wife and three children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. The family has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
In her heart, Cecilia harbors the desire to increase her capital to invest in more inventories of candies, cigarettes and other items to sell. With these, she can create more revenue for her family. Above all, she hopes to offer a better quality of life for her four dependent children. 

Cecilia requests a loan of 20,000 PHP. Specifically, the loan fund will be use to buy more cigarettes, candies and other items to sell. Let’s support this devoted mother to help her bring well-being and security to the members of her family. 

Cecilia believes that her business will help her family rise up and fight against poverty, as well as provide for the needs of her family, most especially in the education of her children. 

Cecilia has been a dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2009.   Cecilia is thankful to receive the loans to support her business dreams. She hopes to diversify her business in the long term to support the basic needs of her family.

The support of ASHI and Kiva Lenders will enable her to finally reach her dreams in life: to have an expanded business, to fund her children’s education until they finish college, to offer them a good life, and to have a happy family. She also dreams of owning a house and lot someday.

She says “Salamat” (Thank You) to ASHI family and Kiva for the trust given to her and her family. For this inspiration, the couple will work harder to prove that they are worthy of this trust. Her family expressed thanks for supporting their dreams in life and their hope of reaching it.

loans.use: To buy candies, cigarettes, and other items to sell

loans.name: Mork

texts.en:
Mork C., 55, is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more fish for his wife to sell. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. Sal is married and resides with his wife and six children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. 

C. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 8 per day. The family must spend USD 90 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 4 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fish for his wife to sell

loans.name: Maxima's Group

texts.en:
Maxima M., from the village of Union Kalingan Luna, Isabela, is the 54-year-old group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maxima, who is married and has six grown children, owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and snacks in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 15 years, she earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Maxima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her third loan for 7000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Maxima plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sarangerel

texts.en:
Sarangerel D., a 36-year-old single parent, lives with her seven-year-old daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Mongolia's Bayanhongor province. Her daughter attends a local primary school, while Sarangerel operates a meat and dairy product selling business in her town. She started her business in a rented stall at the local market in 1998 with working capital of 50,000 MNT. After many years of successful and stable operation, her earnings have enabled her to buy a plot of land and fence for her family, and her family's standard of living has improved greatly.

Sarangerel is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat and dairy products at wholesale prices in order to sell as a retailer. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat and dairy products at wholesale price

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Lean B., from the village of Santa Isabel, is 36 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lean owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2008, Lean joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her sixth loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace runs a sari-sari store. Sari-sari stores basically sell small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. “Sari” is a native word for variety. This is a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far away from the owner’s house. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from the marketplace. 

Mary Grace started her variety store through her initiative of dealing with customers. She wants to continue her business; it gives her family good proceeds to support the educational needs of her two children. She is requesting a loan of PHP20,000 so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. 

Mary Grace dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it to other villages, to send her two children to college, and to have their own beautiful house and land for comfortable living. 

Her children are her inspiration to pursue her variety store. She now feels very happy for the help of ASHI and KIVA partnership, which allows her to pursue her dreams for her family. She hopes that they continue the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead.

She has shown herself to be hard-working to make her dreams come true and hopes that her business will continue to be more productive and improve her overall quality of life for her entire family.

She says “Thank You” to all her Kiva lenders around the world for offering her financial support and giving people a big chance of reaching their dreams in life. She prays that they will be blessed.

loans.use: will buy more food products and basic household necessities

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living for her family. A 39-year-old mother of six children, she lives in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. 

Ursula’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her family; she was thus encouraged to join ASHI, a first Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2009. The previous loans she received from ASHI were carefully invested in her sari-sari (variety) store. Since then, her business has been performing well and earning her sufficient profit. Ursula needs working capital to help boost her business for increased profit making. 

Now, she is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her variety store, to be used to pay for groceries for her enterprise. 

Ursula is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her family and being able to bring them to into a decent way of life. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will in fact give the best direction and opportunity to her family.

loans.use: will be used to pay for groceries for her enterprise

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtaivan K., a 40-year-old widow, lives with her two daughters, two sons-in-laws and two grandchildren in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a small house owned by Enkhtaivan. Her sons-in-laws work in construction as labourers, while her youngest daughter looks after the two children.

Enkhtaivan rents a small workshop where she runs a shoe repair service, a business she has operated since 1998. Having gained much experience and many trusted local customers, she has even taught this skill to her eldest daughter who now runs a shoe repair business as well.

A very enthusiastic and motivated person, Enkhtaivan is planning to extend her business by opening a few more workshops in the area in the future. At the moment she is requesting a loan to increase her working capital and to buy some necessary tools and materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy some necessary tools and materials for business and to increase working capital

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida L. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old. Adelaida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 14485 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Adelaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adelaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, a mother of five, is 54 years old. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who wants to be able to help her family. Working closely with her husband, she makes and sells ready-to-eat food. She started the business 15 years ago to help her family meet its education expenses, as well as water, electricity and food expenses. All of these items are very expensive. 

Now, Nenita has requested 20,000 PHP as additional working capital for her business. She is positive that her business will grow, since she already has regular customers in her local area submitting orders. Specifically, the loan will be used to buy more ingredients. She is pleased because, in the past, she has used the loans to invest in her business.

With working capital, Nenita's business will continue to grow and she will be able to provide excellent products to her regular customers. With the support of Kiva lenders, Nenita hopes to improve the standard of living for herself and her family and lift them out of poverty. 

She dreams of having a permanent space in the marketplace where she can sell her food in order to earn a much larger income. She also dreams of her children completing college. Nenita is glad to ASHI for offering her happiness in life and group support in achieving her goals.

During the course of her membership in ASHI, Nenita has been a model member, dedicated to managing her family’s operations.

loans.use: will be used to buy more ingredients for her business
